Course_Like_Most_TEXT: Being a computer scientist, my mind and thinking habits are heavily influenced by the scientific method. There is so much garbage out there about happiness, extremely misleading by mixing a bit of science with a lot of untested theories and dogmatic "new age" stuff. This course has been such a joy to follow because it is solely based on science and also follows a scientific approach in the presentation of the material. Although I don't see a way of advancing my career with the certificate, I did decide to upgrade to the verified track as I feel that this course is worth every last cent. Hopefully, my contribution will help keep the course (and educational platform) free and available to as many people as possible in the future. Well Done for the course and Thank you for an Excellent educational experience!
Course_Changes_TEXT: I felt that the section “Self directed Neuroplasticity” that contains an essay titled “How to Trick Your Brain for Happiness” by Rick Hanson in week 7 should precede all of the mindfulness material (Week 6), as in my opinion, it sets a clear scientific basis on why mindfulness works.

Forums_Community_TA_TEXT: While I found this course to be very valuable, and while I really appreciated at the end of the course the discussion about individualizing happiness strategies, several times I posted on the discussion areas about what I felt like were overgeneralizations made during the course.  I am not sure how well those comments were heard, validated or understood by Community TAs
Course_Like_Most_TEXT: It offered a wide variety of ways to explore and understand happiness, offered some science behind it, very good at the end it made clear that all people are different, the need to individualize, and to perhaps balance doing what comes naturally with trying things that are harder but which may have as much or more value than what comes easier.
Course_Changes_TEXT: I don't think every scientific observation or conclusion has to be semantically sanitized to cover all bases.  I do think that several times in the course broad overgeneralizations were made, that were.. over..generalized.

Week 7: Mental Habits of Happiness,Week 8: Gratitude,Week 3: Kindness & Compassion,Week 6: Mindfulness,Week 9: Finding Your Happiness Fit & New Frontiers,Week 1: Introduction to the Science of Happiness,Week 2: The Power of Social Connection,Week 4: Cooperation & Reconciliation
Applied_to_life_TEXT:
Really dug into gratitude and self-compassion.  Appreciated the random acts of kindness and am finding joy in it.

Also, wondered why mindfulness didn't resonate with me as much, and loved the last week where the "fit" was discussed.  I also think a bit of it might be that mindfulness and meditation are more difficult for me.  I really believe there is a great benefit from it, so I am going to do more work in this area.  Since it's more difficult for me, I'll probably look for some guided meditations to hopefully get a jump start.

I am able to watch others in a more detached manner.  When others may be disagreeable, I am able to step back, and feel compassion for them, instead of getting personally agitated, which I really am thankful for.

I also really benefited from the discussion on forgiveness.  I struggle with a relationship with my sister, and have actively been trying to forgive her, but have trouble because she continues to trespass.  It was helpful to understand that forgiving doesn't mean that we're condoning behavior.  I may do a little more indepth work on this too!
Impact_TEXT: See above.  Also, my comments on any negativity are that I am grappling with things at work.
Value_TEXT: I follow the GGSC and have attended some sessions.  Not all of the material was new, but it was always helpful reinforcement.  So , if I marked it less than extremely valuable, that is the only reason why.  The ones I marked as extremely, are the ones I need the most help with.
Course_Like_Most_TEXT: I like understanding the science behind happiness.  I liked the exercises.  I liked the end, where it was all put together, and there was discussion about the fit for each individual.  Like that I could find a community, whether the online forums or the facebook page.  (I joined the fb page).
edx_Changes_TEXT: This was my first MOOC.  I think at the beginning I missed some of the reading inadvertently.  Only noticed at the midterm when I didn't know all the material.1
Course_Changes_TEXT:
I usually have lots of suggestions...with this course, in terms of what could be improved, "I got nothing".  ( :

Thank you for offering this class annually. I signed up for it previously and didn't take it, so I appreciate that it's offered annually.

Weeks_Completed: Week 7: Mental Habits of Happiness,Week 8: Gratitude,Week 3: Kindness & Compassion,Week 6: Mindfulness,Week 9: Finding Your Happiness Fit & New Frontiers,Week 1: Introduction to the Science of Happiness,Week 2: The Power of Social Connection,Week 4: Cooperation & Reconciliation
Why_Not_Complete: It took longer than I expected
Why_Not_Complete_TEXT: Hoo boy,  Even being a retiree (with lots of spare time right, hah), I found myself feeling rushed at times to complete the quizzes on time.  Perhaps this was because I took careful written notes on each video and article to help get the concepts inside of the ol'  cranium. On reflection, I realize that in doing so I missed some of the more important contemplative exercises which are now on a list to complete.
Applied_to_life_TEXT: Being trained in science (Ph.D. forester), this gave me confidence that being based on research, the methods would work.  had some background in forgiveness and self compassion from respectively Jack Kornfield and Kristen Neff youtube vids.  Had found those to be useful.  Also long time interest in meditation more recently including taiji and chi kung..  Thus with a science-based green light and some personal experience under my belt, went for it, with the goal of developing habits that worked for me (disarming old negative scripts, practicing kindness, forgiveness, compassion to others and self etc.). And they have.  Lunch with a perceptive friend yesterday, she noted that my mental affect had changed over the last several months from one of depression to being balanced and happy. Interaction with clerks in stores in focused, compassionate and friendly manner.  Feels good internally.
Impact_TEXT:
Personal happiness: went from mouldering depression to increased steady state of soft happiness.
Relationships: my perception is that I fell better when positively interacting and being of service now equipped with better skills.
Work: Retired but volunteer for local hospice and school for the blind.  Also secretary of local Masonic Lodge and help at church. Now feel much more tuned into to where my family (care for 97 year old mother) colleagues, our patients, staff and students masonic Brothers, and fellow church members are coming from mentally and spiritually. Empathy > compassion > service.
World:  Long time AI USA letter writer, which has taken a back seat during course.  Will resume that when course wrapped up and masonic duties completed (dues time...). Can't do it all; relax, prioritize and keep working.
Helping others:  See work comments above.  Perhaps more likely to engage in banal heroism.  
Academic research:  Not now engaged in doing that. Were I still in that field, I feel that this course would have been a good antidote for the competition that can exist in academia and which can get in the way of productivity.
Forums_Community_TA_TEXT: Can't recall seeing a post by a TA (took a while to remember what TA stands for).
Forums_NO_TEXT: Wanted to be of service in posting some questions, and hopefully supportive reponses.  First went to the west coast forum.  Not much activity.  then to the 65+ forum, some solid dialogue.
Value_TEXT: All very good.  the ones I ranked as extremely resonated very highly with where I was and where I wanted to go.
Team_TEXT: posted hopefully helpful questions and supportive comments
Team_Suggestions_TEXT: Hard to say, I tested two teams, west coast and older adults.  Observed little or no activity on the west coasters, more with older adults, thus I switched.
Course_Like_Most_TEXT: Science based, very solid organization, addressed key human questions in highly effective manner, taught easily leanred and implemented (and very cost effective!) practices
edx_Changes_TEXT: None come to mind
Course_Changes_TEXT: See comments I posted on last review forum about disconnect in sentence structure at the start of one paragraph and cell phone use when driving in Zak's article, in the last week.  Otherwise all quite good!

Course_Changes_TEXT: You need a good copyeditor to clean up typos and grammatical errors. Also, the "live" Q&As were recorded, and therefore misleading in terms of their currency. For example, why submit questions when the videos are recorded? In addition, some of the videos don't start at 00:00 and/or end suddenly.

Weeks_Completed: Week 7: Mental Habits of Happiness,Week 8: Gratitude,Week 3: Kindness & Compassion,Week 6: Mindfulness,Week 9: Finding Your Happiness Fit & New Frontiers,Week 1: Introduction to the Science of Happiness,Week 2: The Power of Social Connection,Week 4: Cooperation & Reconciliation
Why_Not_Complete: I had less time than I thought I would
Why_Not_Complete_TEXT: I am not entirely sure.  Sometimes it was difficult to tell that there was more in a given week.  And it was often unclear if I HAD finished all the elements in a week.  We really need an overview with checkmarks for what has been done.
Applied_to_life_TEXT: I attempted to try out each technique, and to filter some of my experience through the concepts presented in lectures.
Impact_TEXT: Since change is a matter of changing habits, and that requires the habit of change, it would be helpful if there were a page of links to instructions for each process.
Forums_NO_TEXT: I am sorry to say that I did not find the discussions engaging.  And in other courses I have participated actively.  I am not sure what the difference was - maybe a bit too much narcissism?
Value_TEXT: I was often surprised how valuable some practices were.  I did not expect the self-compassion letter to be helpful - and it was very much so.  I think gratitude may be my focal practice.
Course_Like_Most_TEXT: I learned about studies and methods with which I was not familiar, as well as support for practices I already like.
edx_Changes_TEXT: I would STRONGLY recommend a simpler checklist of "have I completed this item in this week?" items.
Course_Changes_TEXT: Well, the lecturers were personable and the information good.  But - lectures, lectures, lectures...

Value_TEXT: I feel that the power of social connection week was the most powerful of the group. I believe that a sense of community and belonging is one of the key principles to happiness or at least contentment. If you feel you don't belong or the community feels you don't belong that could lead to many serious issues. As a country the United States is dealing with changing demographics and some people feel their identity is at risk, this mindset has a host of ramifications. If people feel connected in a meaningful way that would solve many many problems. Tribalism in a word is the biggest problem we face as a country.

Weeks_Completed: Week 7: Mental Habits of Happiness,Week 8: Gratitude,Week 3: Kindness & Compassion,Week 6: Mindfulness,Week 9: Finding Your Happiness Fit & New Frontiers,Week 1: Introduction to the Science of Happiness,Week 2: The Power of Social Connection,Week 4: Cooperation & Reconciliation
Applied_to_life_TEXT: I practice mindfulness and meditation daily. This course gave me more practices to incorporate in my daily life. My mindfulness and meditation practices have been enriched by understanding the happiness practices and the scientific information presented in this course. A key component of mindfulness is curiosity. The Science of Happiness course offered a lot of information about happiness that inspired curiosity in my personal practices.
Impact_TEXT: I am an academic at heart. I love learning and feel that the scientific approach to the Happiness course bolstered my understanding as well as my motivation to teach and practice this information.
Forums_Community_TA_TEXT: Not that I am acutely aware of off the top of my head.
Forums_NO_TEXT: I participated in the discussion forums because they offered opportunities for me to think through relevant questions about the material presented in the course, as well as a chance to read what fellow course participants were thinking about the same topic.
Course_Like_Most_TEXT: I felt that the videos from Dacher and Emiliana were personable and understandable. I really appreciate the wealth of scientific information available from a variety of researchers, as well as the plethora of research papers I was able to access for future study. I also found the explanations about the research methods used in various studies to be enriching. For example, statements about the need for more research in an area and an explanation as to why more research is necessary bolstered my trust and confidence in the research used throughout the course. I am surrounded by Ph.D.'s in my peer group, Many of them have expressed some doubt about the science underpinning happiness (although none of them have actually taken the time to read the research!). It is very helpful to be able to contribute to a conversation about the scientific studies/methods used to study this area of well-being.

Weeks_Completed: Week 7: Mental Habits of Happiness,Week 8: Gratitude,Week 3: Kindness & Compassion,Week 6: Mindfulness,Week 9: Finding Your Happiness Fit & New Frontiers,Week 1: Introduction to the Science of Happiness,Week 2: The Power of Social Connection,Week 4: Cooperation & Reconciliation
Applied_to_life_TEXT: I'm a pharmacist. And I apply everyday what I've learned in this course with my patient. I often speak about psychologic problems with my patient (abuse, death, divorce, problem about accepting a serious disease, about children, depression,...) and so compassion, listening without judging people, meditation, forgiveness is very helpful. My patient are happier and so I feel happier too! In my personal life, it's the same. I practice everyday the 3 good things, the gratitude and often as possible the Awe and the meditation. And I try to be grateful with my husband, children and friends.
Impact_TEXT: At work (pharmacy), I received a lot of gifts from my patient. I'm sure it is because I have more compassion and I try harder to help them and they are grateful for that. It's amazing! In my personal life, I'm less angry about the things that not go the way I want, I notice more often my feelings and emotions  without judging thanks to mindfulness. So I appreciate more the good moments in my life and the impact of the bad things is lesser. I try to learn to the others as much as I can what I learned in this course. I feel so happy to do that.
Forums_NO_TEXT: I speak french, so it takes too much time for me to find the vocabulary and the good meaning of the sentences. If it was in French, for sure, I would  have do it. And too much time to write and be sure that I pick up the right word to express my feelings.
Course_Like_Most_TEXT:
To learn new skills
The scientific approach of this course
To do practical exercise each week
To see fast results about  enhancing happiness
Course_Changes_TEXT:
I'm a little bit joking but I would have liked to hear a special music or to see a special picture appear when I succeeded my final exam. Like  "Yes you did it, congratulations!!" 
More seriously, for each week, I would have like to have "a percentage bar" to see the progression of work during the week. Because it's difficult to evaluate how much time you need to achieve a week of course. With a percentage bar, you know when you are at the middle by exemple. I know that each week, you have "sections" but all the sections don't have the same lenght. For the person like me who doesn't speak english (as native language), it takes more time to completely understand an essay or a video because we need to translate a lot of words. After several weeks, it become easier because it is the same vocabulary that comes back again and again.

Weeks_Completed: Week 7: Mental Habits of Happiness,Week 8: Gratitude,Week 3: Kindness & Compassion,Week 6: Mindfulness,Week 9: Finding Your Happiness Fit & New Frontiers,Week 1: Introduction to the Science of Happiness,Week 2: The Power of Social Connection,Week 4: Cooperation & Reconciliation
Applied_to_life_TEXT: Gratitude letter, little else.
Impact_TEXT: I am a working psychotherapist, and was in a pretty good place in my life before the course.
Forums_NO_TEXT: I posted a note a couple of times, did not know how to stay abreast of the discussions, and did not see them as "discussions," as most of what I did see were simply comments posted over time.
Course_Like_Most_TEXT:
Learning about the various studies that support happiness science, and the science itself.  I did not come to the course with an agenda focused on increasing my happiness, but on learning about the science so that I may use it in doing the therapy that has been my career for close to 50 years.  I have been studying Mindfulness fora few years, now, and really enjoyed that segment, but as a reinforcement, as it were, of what I've learned.  
The course did point me to Csikszentmihalyi's book, which I finished yesterday.  It reminded me of Dan Siegel's book, "Mind...," which I will seek out shortly.
Course_Changes_TEXT: Stop using the 3/4 angles for the videos.  Having the sense that the speaker is talking to someone, virtually over my shoulder, did not have a salutary dramatic effect, it was annoying, off putting!

Weeks_Completed: Week 7: Mental Habits of Happiness,Week 8: Gratitude,Week 3: Kindness & Compassion,Week 6: Mindfulness,Week 9: Finding Your Happiness Fit & New Frontiers,Week 1: Introduction to the Science of Happiness,Week 2: The Power of Social Connection,Week 4: Cooperation & Reconciliation
Applied_to_life_TEXT: A lot of the happiness practices taught are already incorporated into my everyday life. The material gave me a few new ideas to change up and / or add to my already happy and gratitude practices. It was good to learn the different studies that have been done to further provide some proof that a happiness set points can be increased and the health benefits that are associated. I have never looked at the physical benefits.
Impact_TEXT: The academic research that was provided was amazing and caused a craving to learn more.  I did learn thru this course that my level of compassion was low.  While my empathy levels are high, acting on a level of compassion was low.
Forums_Community_TA_TEXT: No, not at all.
Forums_NO_TEXT: It was indicated in the introduction that I would get more out of the course if I participated in the discussion fourms.
Value_TEXT: "Valuable"  that is the wrong word.  I found the course, informative, not was interactive as I had expected. The practices were presented in a well instructed way.
Course_Like_Most_TEXT: the live feed
edx_Changes_TEXT: I don't know any.  I took the course as a continuing education class and it required more of my time than I had allowed or anticipated.  More like when I was in college in my early adulthood, instead of a continuing to broaden my mind in my late forties.
Course_Changes_TEXT: It would be wonderful, if all the course-ware was available at the beginning of the course allowing for you to work thru the course in and on your time frame.  I like the deadlines for the quiz's and midterm and final; these need completion date.  But, it would have been wonderful I had I had access to the course-ware to be able to accommodate completing a particular week in  the course without the additional stress of cramming the course-ware in around my travel/work schedule.  The airport and plan would have been a perfect place to have had access to the course-ware.

Weeks_Completed: Week 7: Mental Habits of Happiness,Week 8: Gratitude,Week 3: Kindness & Compassion,Week 6: Mindfulness,Week 9: Finding Your Happiness Fit & New Frontiers,Week 1: Introduction to the Science of Happiness,Week 2: The Power of Social Connection,Week 4: Cooperation & Reconciliation
Applied_to_life_TEXT: This course impacted my life so positively. I have already meditated for some years and doing exercises of gratitude, but now I feel I have many tools to help me daily. What I most enjoy was the 3 best things of the day. Everyone in my family is join this exercise and we fell so happy to know about the good things of the day of each other. This course has wonderful differential (the extension in time). The extension (10 weeks), in my opinion, is a tremendous advantage. This is because the issues presented here, though simple, require time and practice to be assimilated. I have to thank everyone that somehow helped in preparing the course and say that fills me my heart with hope and happiness to know that so many people are engaged in research like these presented. I am also very proud to have participated in this course and I can say that I feel different now than two months ago. I feel I am an even better person, more attentive to me and around me, stronger and more enlightened. It would be wonderful if the course be translated into other languages so that many other people could participate and obtain this knowledge. Here in Brazil the minority of the population understands English (it was difficult for me too), and I have some friends that did not join the course for this reason. Congratulations and a thank you especially to Dacher and Emiliana. Life brings you double happiness ;-)
Forums_NO_TEXT: I wish I had more time to participate more. My English does not help and it made me to stay hours a day to take in the weekly informations course.
Course_Like_Most_TEXT: the videos
edx_Changes_TEXT: translate into other languages
Course_Changes_TEXT: translate into other languages

Weeks_Completed: Week 1: Introduction to the Science of Happiness
Applied_to_life_TEXT: There were a key few exercises or stats that I remembered. Awe and random acts of kindness are the easiest for me to apply everyday because I feel as if I already implement them in my life.
Impact_TEXT: I tried to remember several of the practices outlined in this course to practice in my everyday life, however sometimes time got away from me or I was frustrated/stressed with something or another. I also don't feel like it impacted my ability to help others or compassion for the world because I feel as if I had already practiced these things in my life.
Forums_Community_TA_TEXT: Not that I can remember. There were a few posts that emulated how I felt about the week's discussion topics so I commented on those instead of writing my own thoughts.
Forums_NO_TEXT: I wanted to be engaged in the course. Since I didn't know anyone else taking it, I wanted to have some interactions with real people and feel like I had similar thoughts to others.
Value_TEXT: It was easier for me to find the sections that I already practiced more helpful. I think it was harder for me to feel engaged in sections like mindfulness and forgiveness because I inherently don't practice these. While I believe in the power of meditation and understand how important it is to be forgiving, it's harder for me to practice these.
Course_Like_Most_TEXT: I enjoyed the lectures and learning about the science behind happiness. I enjoyed learning about how examining happiness has existed for some time and the biological components to happiness.
edx_Changes_TEXT: Sometimes it was hard to deal with the Qualtrics surveys imbedded into the course. I also was not a fan of the progress chart including the weekly check in's since they weren't graded. While I took this class for pleasure, I also was invested in doing well so I didn't like that if I had a bad week, that impacted the score for this class.
Course_Changes_TEXT: I was not a fan of the readings after the lectures that presented the same information. There were some readings/lectures that had the same activities, scientists, theories, etc. I would have rather read or listened to the information once.

Why_Not_Complete_TEXT: There are a lot of material to read and english is my second language, so I have to use the dictionary, so I took me a lot of time. I just watched all the videos and I browsed the tests but I did not answer them. On the other hand I do not have much time but I want to do it without the pressure of the schedule you gave.  Sometimes was difficult for me to grasp all the concepts. I learnt british english in the eighties and I live in Bogotà, Colombia, South America, so american english is a little bit different. My background is music and raja yoga (www.brahmakumaris.org), and I realised that I will have to brush up my english. I think the course is fantastic but I need more time to cover the whole lessons and I think on the second time I will answer the tests. Sorry for not being able to make it as you expected it. I am very greatful for providing such deep course and I hope you allow me to do it on my own time. Thank you very much indeed to all the wonderful teachers who have dedicated their energy to create this marvellous material. In raja yoga I had worked on happiness but from the spiritual perspective of the soul not of the body - sense organs, brain and external relationships-, althought there is a close connection. Next civilization in almost 50 years time more or less I reckon, will be very happy but in soul consciusness, not in body consciusness. Many teachings from your course have a relationship with the ideas of happiness in raja yoga. That is why I want to cover the whole course you provided, very thoroughly  or exhaustively. Thank you very much indeed to all the team that made this course on line possible and thanks to the staff of the university as well. Yours sincerely Mireya.
Impact_TEXT: It is difficult for me to answer this because I did not apply it in my life I just had the time to watch the videos and browse the material. That was all.
Course_Like_Most_TEXT: It is difficult to say because I have not read all the material yet and I have not done the exercoses and the test yet
edx_Changes_TEXT: It is hard for tme to say yet ...
Course_Changes_TEXT: To provide more time...

I think Trump's first presidential decree should be we should all take this course!

Forums_NO_TEXT: In my best Simpsons Comic Book Guy Impression: WORST MESSAGE BOARDS SOFTWARE EVER
Value_TEXT: Overall excellent course. Great content and am hoping it stays open for access to the material so I can find time to follow up on the want to learn more links

edx_Changes_TEXT: SRSLY NEW MESSAGE BOARD SOFTWARE.  Coursera was a lot easier to use.  the platform didn't get in the way where I feel ike eDX's platform detracts from the class.  I've seen UMass and Brandeis's online platforms as well and while they weren't great they were a lot easier to follow and use than this.  Come on MIT and Harvard.  You don't have any user experience nerds that can help with this?!
Course_Changes_TEXT: Not 100% sure this would work but I think each module should be 2 weeks instead of one to really give people time to try the practices and maybe read some of the more information material. Applied_to_life_TEXT: Specifically to mindfulness, I have a daily formal practice and do my best to incorporate several short informal practices daily. I do not have a gratitude journal but practice being grateful daily.

Value_TEXT: Each week I learned a new topic connected to happiness, for example, trust and reconciliation. I enjoyed the research on the evolution of each topic too. If we can just spend time engaging in a few of the happiness practices, I cannot imagine how wonderfully happy people could and would be. We need to spread this knowledge - it's so powerful.

Weeks_Completed: Week 7: Mental Habits of Happiness,Week 8: Gratitude,Week 3: Kindness & Compassion,Week 6: Mindfulness,Week 9: Finding Your Happiness Fit & New Frontiers,Week 1: Introduction to the Science of Happiness,Week 2: The Power of Social Connection,Week 4: Cooperation & Reconciliation
Applied_to_life_TEXT: I practice mindfulness often. I practice gratitude consciously and increasingly, and I keep looking for ways to do RAK. I am increasingly conscious of class info and ways to implement  it.
Value_TEXT: I was simply very ready and open to receiving the info in this course. I was looking for such a course. Because the information was so well-organized and logically presented, it was easy to take in, comprehend and build on, week after week. Not sure I see the value of weekly check-ins. Not sure how measures can be meaningful given that a student might check in at different times of day, in different places...so many variables. Placing the following thought here in case there is no opportunity to do so elsewhere in this survey: Happiness score tanked in week 10 because of the US presidential election. I am curious if you can see a "dip" across the board that correlates.
Course_Like_Most_TEXT: The way the information was so well-organized and presented. Clear, logical, well-spaced. Love the referential material. Bought Dacher's book, and read a chapter or two each week..info dovetailed nicely and reinforced course material.
edx_Changes_TEXT: Include any info gathered on the benefit of any of the exercises that could be done without writing them...how could an ongoing "mental" list, or composing "mental" letters be of benefit, since these can be done readily, easily and anywhere...perhaps combining exercises, like a "mental gratitude journal" and the awe walk.
Course_Changes_TEXT: Add a forum for submitting questions each week (as done in McGill's Food For Thought" course, wherein TAs can respond individually.

Why_Not_Complete_TEXT: I did complete all the coursework, but it was a lot more demanding than, I believe, the about 4 hours of work per week.  I was spending a lot more time.  Lot of reading and videos.  I didn't have time to do any of the extra readings etc.  Will go back until May 1 and do all the extra if you are interested parts.
Applied_to_life_TEXT: I do this work on a smaller scale with workshops, but I am always working on myself and walking the talk.  I wanted to fully do the practices without believing I knew what the results were.  Maybe that is part of why this class took 10 or 15 hours weekly for me.  I wanted to truly get all the benefits I could out of it.
Impact_TEXT: I've been on this journey for about 19 months intentionally and have already incorporated many of these practices in my whole life or otherwise everything would have been immensely.  Love this stuff, love having found the Greater Good Science Center.  I can't wait to go through all that your website has to offer.  Thank you for this gift you gave to me.  I feel like Emiliana and Dacher are part of my circle now.
Forums_Community_TA_TEXT: not really
Forums_NO_TEXT: I was already committing to about 10 hours  a week between the readings, videos, home practice.  Didn't want to commit more time.
Course_Like_Most_TEXT: The material was rich with scientific evidence or suggestions of evidence.
edx_Changes_TEXT: There is a lot of repetitiveness with readings or a video followed by readings that say the same thing.  I get the feeling I am just really slow at scholastic tasks now.  It takes me awhile to absorb and then move on.  It was a huge commitment for me and happiness teachings should be beautiful not stressful. Okay, the stress came from reading everything so I could do well on the quizzes and tests.  Without that I think I would have just read and enjoyed.
Course_Changes_TEXT: Why can't we just take the quizzes and tests until we get them right?  At 59, I don't want to feel pressured with tests etc around happiness.  I will tell you that I got As on the tests, but for me it is  a stress thing.  I'll work on letting go of the I'm not smart enough inner critic.

Applied_to_life_TEXT: I employ the gratitude journal, mindfulness, awe activities, and active listening regularly, i.e. several times a week.  I try to treat all people with kindness and respect.
Impact_TEXT: This is the second time that I have taken GG101x.  I am repeating the course because I plan to facilitate a group of learners beginning in January 2017.  I had the good fortune to participate in GGSC's summer institute for educators and while there I was struck by the universality of GG101x experience among the institute participants.  When asked by my superintendent how I might best help spread the word about the institute, I suggested facilitating a Science of Happiness group, so that is our plan for the winter/spring.
Forums_NO_TEXT: I posted as I felt I had something to say.  Time constraints limited my ability to participate.
Course_Like_Most_TEXT: The opportunity to focus on positive strategies to increase my overall well being and to enable me to help others experience greater well being.
Course_Changes_TEXT: On a regular basis simply update GG101x as new data becomes available.

Applied_to_life_TEXT: It has really made me think about my relationships, and how I respond or communicate about situations.  I'm also trying not to be so critical on myself and learn to be grateful for what I have around me rather than striving for something better as a gauge to how happy I am.

Some parts were not so easy to accept as they challenged my everyday thinking but I didn't like I was failing as a person or I had a problem.

Weeks_Completed: Week 8: Gratitude
Why_Not_Complete_TEXT: I think i just didn't do the one on discussion on if I had to give an apology to another. I took time to finish the course and I finished all work within a week or two therefore to do all activities i didn't have the required time but will use it as practice in the months to come and see what works for me the best.
Applied_to_life_TEXT: I write a gratitude journal, I want to give gratitude letters to everyone but I thought before I get married i will give everyone a gratitude letter or on their special occasions still have not decided. I want to do the awe walk whether its going out of my locality or within. It helps one concentrate at the task at hand and makes it more interesting. I also would like to do Random acts o kindness as i have been doing for many years now with the people who work for me and can't find enough cash to make ends meet. Learning from this course help me name the activities that I was doing  otherwise. And I truly felt peaceful with the loving kindness meditation. I truly loved that one.
Impact_TEXT: It makes one feel good that the simple things one does in life there is a study behind it to make it more interesting. One can apply many of the stuff we have studied in different aspects of our lives and at different and appropriate times. It was interesting to note that yes too much of gratitude can actually back fire. So one has to draw a balance. To say it when we mean it.

Value_TEXT: I found it very light and helpful. I will go through it and see which practices I can incorporate in my daily life and use the ones i feel most comfortable with.

Applied_to_life_TEXT: I like the meditation practice especially the loving-kindness version; I also like and the three good things.   I also love the Awe walk which is something I tend to do anyway as I love nature.  I am somewhat of a half full person so this course has shown me ways to get a grip on my thinking and to reframe the way I view bad things that happen to get something positive out of it.
Impact_TEXT: The course has helped me see more clearly what I do and don't do in life that is adding or taking away from my happiness. I am a pretty compassionate person and have good relationships with friends and famlly.  I recently lost my husband so my mood has been  depressed due to that.  I can see where the course will help me though once I come to grips with my grief.
Forums_Community_TA_TEXT: I remember seeing a Community TA comment but I don't recall what the subject was.
Forums_NO_TEXT: I don't really like the set up of the online discussion as there are just too many discussion headings and it takes forever to read through the different comments and find more that just a single post each time.   I gave up looking at the discussion pages.
edx_Changes_TEXT: Make the discussion easier to follow by thread.

I have learned to be more grateful for everything good that has happend to me and for the people who are good to me. The course has showed me that it is important to keep the silly little plays I have with my boyfriend, that bring us some good laughs. Week 7: Mental Habits of Happiness,Week 8: Gratitude,Week 3: Kindness & Compassion,Week 6: Mindfulness,Week 9: Finding Your Happiness Fit & New Frontiers,Week 1: Introduction to the Science of Happiness,Week 2: The Power of Social Connection,Week 4: Cooperation & Reconciliation
Applied_to_life_TEXT: it was very interesting to learn the different ways happiness is created.  It gave me more knowledge to apply to taking control and making me happier.  I appreciated learning about happiness.  Then applying it to my life.  It had a positive impact on my life.  I feel happier.
Impact_TEXT: I was able to take control of my life and create the true meaning of my happiness.  My relationships became brighter and more meaningful.  The satisfaction and productivity increased when I looked on a more positive side and created more happiness in the work place.  I have always been a person to help others.  I feel that was my purpose in life and I love it.  It really makes me happy.  My academic research has broaden and that makes me feel very happy in my life.  I feel happier and look for more positive things in my life and around me.
Forums_NO_TEXT: I AM SO BUSY THAT I NEVER MET THE DEADLINES TO BEGIN THE COURSES AND THEREFORE MISSED THE FORUMS
Value_TEXT: It was amazing to find this information and apply it to my daily life.  I feel that I have benefited in more than one area and that applying it has given me a greater happiness.  It was a pleasure to do this course.  I wish I would of had more time to spend on each lesson.  But I did find it a very worth while course and did benefit from the information that I was provided.  It has broadened my knowledge of happiness.  Things that make you happy and how they make you happy.  I am thankful for taking this course.

Weeks_Completed: Week 7: Mental Habits of Happiness,Week 8: Gratitude,Week 3: Kindness & Compassion,Week 6: Mindfulness,Week 9: Finding Your Happiness Fit & New Frontiers,Week 1: Introduction to the Science of Happiness,Week 2: The Power of Social Connection,Week 4: Cooperation & Reconciliation

Why_Not_Complete: I only completed what was most interesting to me
Applied_to_life_TEXT: The course has given me a different outlook on humanity. I now perceive humans as having evolved to be kind, generous and altruistic under many circumstances and have the knowledge to back it up. I also really valued the material on the brain and mindfulness and how the brain can change through meditation. That was a really powerful insight. I really enjoyed applying the insights into my daily life to increase my own and other people's wellbeing. Specifically the insights on the importance of human relationships, the value of gratitude, the experience of flow, the effectiveness of mindfulness have impacted my life. It is very nice to be able to back intuitive insights up with research and be capable of explaining the science to other people. My favourite happiness practice was the awe walk. I will definitely do that  more often.
Forums_NO_TEXT: I prefer to discuss the topics with people face to face since I get much more value out of that direct connection. However, I do think it is good that the discussion forums are there. Maybe you could add an online call where people get split into groups and discuss matters through video conferencing?
Course_Like_Most_TEXT: The application of scientific knowledge to a practical level which greatly enhances your own and other people's well being. I also liked that the Science of Happiness blends different fields, from psychology to neuroscience to philosophy to sociology.
Course_Changes_TEXT: Maybe add videoconferences to the course content where students can discuss the class topics online.

Applied_to_life_TEXT: I am a health professional (Chiropractor) and this course really connected me with my patients in ways I never imagined. I took this course to be more helpful to my patients and it ended up helping me immensely.
Impact_TEXT: As mentioned earlier, this course positively impacted my practice as a health practitioner because I was able to understand the frustration and pain patients presented with and I was able to really help them not only with their physical pain but caring for them. In addition, I implemented different practices in my personal life like Three Good Things, Gratitude Journal, Gratitude letter, Mindfulness, Acts of Kindness, etc. They really help me to forgive grudges I was holding and in the long run empowered me to finally achieve many goals I have in my life and the relationship with my husband.
Forums_NO_TEXT: I didn't participate much because in general the course takes a lot of time and I used to do it during my short breaks or lunch breaks while working.
Value_TEXT: The best weeks for me were Power of Social Connection, Kindness and Compassion, Mindfulness and Gratitude.
Course_Like_Most_TEXT: The videos and the different practices like Three Good Things, Random Acts of Kindness, etc.
edx_Changes_TEXT: Make summaries of the readings because sometimes they are too long and you loose tracks of the ideas. Make more general questions in the midterm/final exams because some questions enter in too much detail from weeks ago.
Course_Changes_TEXT: It is a great course!

Weeks_Completed: Week 7: Mental Habits of Happiness,Week 8: Gratitude,Week 3: Kindness & Compassion,Week 6: Mindfulness,Week 9: Finding Your Happiness Fit & New Frontiers,Week 1: Introduction to the Science of Happiness,Week 2: The Power of Social Connection,Week 4: Cooperation & Reconciliation
Applied_to_life_TEXT:
I tried all of the happiness practices and continued the ones that "fit" with my personality and ability to perform them repeatedly (like all of the meditations and writing exercises); 

I started to better understand myself and my own problems, such as perfectionism and complete lack of self compassion and have slowly applied different thinking towards myself and my high/unrealistic expectations (and it's improved my mood and well-being substantially!) 

This course has made me be much more pro-active towards improving my happiness, I began therapy treatment once a week and I joined an MBSR class and yoga course - the fact that I did this on my own is very significant (in the past I would rely on a doctor's orders or a family member's strong recommendation.) 

The forgiveness practice has been incredibly helpful in teaching me how to slowly begin the process towards people who have repeatedly hurt me - so far it has been a huge weight off my shoulders, thank you <3 <3 <3 

Taking this course also gave me tons of inspiration to create personal materials for me to be more accountable towards continuous happiness practices. I haven't allowed myself to create anything in a very long time (fear of failure issues) and I'm so excited about this! Again, thank you :)
Impact_TEXT:
I take deep breaths at work when confronted with issues that would normally annoy me (they still annoy me, but I'm not so quick with a negative response or remark) - it also makes me more open to people's suggestions even when I think I have the perfect solution to a problem. I believe my personal attitude towards work has relaxed substantially and coincidentally I have gotten more freelance work offers than I really need. 

My self compassion has improved dramatically - I hurt my back and gave myself plenty of time to recover. This is a drastic difference in comparison to my old self who would "tough it out" and have enormous amounts of anxiety for missing work. I'm also becoming more and more aware of my constant need for perfectionism and instead of beating myself over the head about it, I'm approaching this with curiosity and compassion - allowing the thoughts to move through while being aware of them and non- judgmental... it's been interesting getting to know me this way.

I've been better able to talk to my husband about things that have made me angry in a constructive and solution seeking ways. Our relationship is now more filled with communication and less so with passive aggressive behavior. I'm more willing to work at it and my husband is responding in mirroring ways.

I'm interested in pursuing more academic courses in psychology and possibly pursue a career change in counseling or art therapy. It's exciting to be excited about school and possible new beginnings in my life.
Forums_Community_TA_TEXT: Not really.
Forums_NO_TEXT: I'm sorry to say this, but I didn't find discussions helpful at all - at times it felt like a huge waste of time going through everyone's comments. I replied a couple of times to other people's comments and noticed TA's comments but there was nothing really interesting for me to want to go back and see if someone replied to what I had to say. The only time that discussion felt useful was for submitting questions to the live Q&A sessions. I think if there was some sort of "notification" feedback that someone commented on my comment or someone also replied to a comment I replied on, it would have made me be more aware of an ongoing conversation and more motivating for me to return to it (like facebook notifications do). But, quite honestly, I was glad the discussions were quiet - one less thing buzzing at me is nice.
Value_TEXT: I think it was all valuable and my differences in ratings for week 1 and week 9 were because on week 1 I was still trying to find my footing in how to go about the class and take notes and familiarize myself with EdEx, and week 9, since I'm behind schedule I felt a little more anxiety to just get through it and finish it!
Course_Like_Most_TEXT: Having exercises that I could apply to my everyday life and test it out.
edx_Changes_TEXT: Discussion comment "notification" - something similar to facebook, so I know if someone commented on something I said, or replied in a comment I also replied to.
Course_Changes_TEXT:
I wish I could print a lot of the articles that I read, only because I learn better by highlighting things and adding these to my personal notes (or make the articles read-only but interactive, like google docs? so I can take digital personal notes and highlight text?) 

I did copy and paste all of the happiness practices so I could print them out and have them on my happiness binder, I also screen captured some good stuff from the videos and shared them on facebook with my family and friends. Hope that's okay!!

Applied_to_life_TEXT: I'm a chaplain and I find this information very useful to those who are 'spiritually homeless'. I often use 'gratitude' as a point of discussion with patients and families. I hope GGSC reaches out to ACPE or SCA (Spiritual Care Association) to see how you guys can partner in chaplain education programs.
Impact_TEXT: The research was validating - I'm a devout Catholic and this scientific research confirmed my belief and highlighted my traditions have 'real' basis for wellbeing. For thousands of years people instinctively knew much of this information and the physiological science research is comforting.  This does NOT contradict the belief in a  higher power and my ability to convey this to others who are unbelievers in God has increased.
Value_TEXT: Sorry but I just didn't have time - I was engrossed in the materials and I often went off track when exploring the materials - there is a lot there and listening or reading other people's opinions is just not time well spent for me - I'd rather be researching / reading the 'experts'.

edx_Changes_TEXT: Oh boy - I have tons more website favorites and ordered several books!  I have lots of reading and more practicing to do.
Course_Changes_TEXT: Make getting credit easier - I tried to apply on-line but couldn't seem to figure out - I need to call so I can get a certificate - not that I need it or will get something for it but I feel like I put a lot of time and energy into this work and want something to show for it.

Week 7: Mental Habits of Happiness,Week 8: Gratitude,Week 3: Kindness & Compassion,Week 6: Mindfulness,Week 9: Finding Your Happiness Fit & New Frontiers,Week 1: Introduction to the Science of Happiness,Week 2: The Power of Social Connection,Week 4: Cooperation & Reconciliation
Applied_to_life_TEXT: I have worked to be more understanding of others as well as increased my patience and understanding.
Impact_TEXT: I took this class for personal growth rather than "academic research", but I chose Moderately on that question because this course has taught me quite a bit even though it wasn't for any "official" academic reasons.
Forums_Community_TA_TEXT: I did not spend as much time "involved" in the discussion baords as I had planned, but I did browse post replies quite frequently and appreciated what my classmates had to say.  As an aside, I am also enjoying the things my classmates have posted on the group Facebook page!
Forums_NO_TEXT: I participated in the discussion forums in order to allow myself to have the full course experience.  I am not sure if there is an option to be notified if people reply to your post, but I didn't see one.  That would have been helpful to foster ongoing discussions between students.
Value_TEXT: All of the weeks were great!  In case there isn't a chance to comment on this later, in the earlier part of the survey I rated the check-ins a little low simply because I think subconsiously they were easy to "sway" towards positive scores because we knew what the point of the class was.  I tried not to sway my scores but it may have been impossible not to do so, even though I was completely honest during the answering.
Happiness_Team_Name: Team Looking for a Better Name
Team_TEXT: I'm not sure if I answered this question correctly, but I did open a Happiness Team thread and attempted to lead it but several people did individual introduction posts so things sort of went haywire.  I responded to items in the discussion board a small handful of times until it became unfulfilling or I thought I was just talking to the wind.  I have always had a hard time staying engaged in that sort of forum, though, so this was no real fault of the boards themselves (except perhaps that email notification thing I mentioned in an earlier answer).
Team_Suggestions_TEXT: Enable email notifications for post replies if it is not already enabled, and make that function easy to activate
Course_Like_Most_TEXT: I enjoyed learning about the various happiness practices and I appreciate the concept of self-efficacy because I struggle with feeling not capable or good enough at times.  I also love the various resources on the GGSC website and plan to use them more frequently.
edx_Changes_TEXT: Please see notes below.  I have only used edX once before and see no issues with the platform as a whole.
Course_Changes_TEXT: I have taken one previous course on edX and if I remember correctly, that course allowed you to click on the Week and see all of the individual modules so you could go directly to a portion of the module, and this course didn't seem to do that.  For instance, if I click on Week 6, I can see that it has seven sections, but it's impossible to tell how many subsections are contained within those sections.  This makes it a bit hard to schedule time for the course because some sections are much longer than others and it would be nice to have an approximate idea of length going in.  I also think it would be great if the "Theater" posts were able to link us to full movies, because they may be hard to locate for those of us that don't have access to streaming services, but I do understand the constraints there.

Weeks_Completed: Week 7: Mental Habits of Happiness,Week 8: Gratitude,Week 3: Kindness & Compassion,Week 6: Mindfulness,Week 9: Finding Your Happiness Fit & New Frontiers,Week 1: Introduction to the Science of Happiness,Week 2: The Power of Social Connection,Week 4: Cooperation & Reconciliation
Applied_to_life_TEXT: I work as a psychotherapist and have found all of the course material really helpful - to me as a therapist, and to many of my clients. I've also shared the material with other practitioners in my office - posting some of the Greater Good articles on the bulletin board and printing out specific topics and exercises for other clinicians to share. I have made two specific exercises part of my daily routine - mindfulness meditation and random acts of kindness.
Impact_TEXT: I am a lot more mindful on a regular basis and this alone has increased my personal level of happiness. That I happen to be in a career that allows me to practice as much mindfulness, kindness, compassion, etc. as I want, is icing.
Forums_NO_TEXT: Time constraints mostly but I am also not someone who enjoys on-line discussions - I'm more of an "in-person" type.
Course_Like_Most_TEXT: Videos were great - some wonderful speakers! I liked how the course was structured by week, and even found having quizzes helpful to keep me on track. And, having the Greater Good website to access added a lot, too - sometimes I found myself getting lost in some of the articles - Flow!
edx_Changes_TEXT: It preferred the videos that were set up more like a lecture in front of an audience - I found them more engaging than someone sitting and speaking directly in front of the camera from a script. Maybe there is better way to do intros so that they don't seem like infomercials.

edx_Changes_TEXT:
It's discussion forum is not user friendly, does not leave much scope to promote discussion. Each response in a thread should have option to get an upvote and further response to it should also have option to get upvote. At time thread itself is not great to begin with but discussion is robust.
2. All threads where a TA has replied should have visible- TA replied in the list of as well, no need to open thread.
3. Threads should have option to view latest first/ oldest first . 
4. Unread threads despite many in number , at times appear nill or only 3 to 4, so this unpredictably should not be there.
5. As a TA, we should be able to be in direct touch with course development team.
6. As a TA , there should be portal within discussion forum that is exclusively meant and to TA.
7. Most names in forum are alias/ assumed names, there should be guidance to add a space_ or- to separate 2 words, it is easy to read and address. Promote people participating with real names. 
8. There should be a portal where TA can put their wishlist of changes so that tech team can work on it to make forum more user friendly. I am also mentor on Coursera and we add to development and growth of platform in real time, needless to say Coursera has become platform of my choice, despite my journey to MOOCs starting from EdX. Hope to see atleast a few changes .
Course_Changes_TEXT: Course is amazing no doubt, and so are contents. The sincerity and efforts of Teachers are more than visible. Despite all pluses the course is a little dull. There is sort of lack of energy. Contents have more mention of research names, so much repeatedly ( I understand that their hard work needs to be acknowledged) but in a video it can be acknowledged once or twice, in shortest possible way, there by making course length a bit short. A few things can be added to resource section for further reading - research papers and books. I have taken similar courses elsewhere, but this course always needed a little more effort to finish despite having best content among all. Reason could be " low energy sets in with each video, with each reading" That definitely does not mean that I will not take it one more time, but I wish I feel enthusiastic while taking it next time.

Why_Not_Complete: I had less time than I thought I would
Why_Not_Complete_TEXT: Although I completed all the coursework, I did not have enough time to do all the Happiness Practices, because I was away traveling for 5 weeks during the course and had to 'catch up', however I do plan to try them all out in the next few months, to see which ones are the best fit
Applied_to_life_TEXT: I have enhanced and slightly modified some of my 'routine' practices and have brought a few more in.  I also have more 'data' on which things might help increase happiness in my life and those I love if things start to take a downturn.
Forums_NO_TEXT: I find the structure of the discussion forums problematic - and this is an EdX issue, not a specific course issue.  It is difficult to isolate your own posts and go back and see if there is feedback or discussion on them.  Also, I think a simple change of having the most recent posts at the top of the list instead of the bottom would encourage more interaction between more people.  Right now everyone has access to the first 25 posts, while only the really motivated people will go beyond that.
Course_Like_Most_TEXT: The tools for increasing happiness in my own life and the feedback from the quizzes (like how grateful are you etc.)
edx_Changes_TEXT: I already suggested this in an earlier comment, but will repeat here as it is specific to the course platform.  I find the discussion groups very clumsy to use and not encouraging to discussion per se.  Because it is impossible to isolate your own posts or get feedback when someone comments on one of your posts, it doesn't really promote discussion.  Also because the oldest posts are at the top, people who post later do not get as much feedback.  If the most recent posts were at the top, then I think it would even out the feedback - as people added their own posts, they would look back on the most recent 10 or 20 posts (and further if intensely interested).
Course_Changes_TEXT: After the Happiness Practice, include in the surveys a comments section where people can explain a bit more about why they did or didn't do the practice.  I found the selection buttons too limiting as they didn't apply.  Sometimes I didn't have time that week, but planned to do it the following week, or already did some variant of the practice so didn't do it.

Course_Like_Most_TEXT: I loved this course!! I was so much interested in knowing about each topic every week . I enjoyed reading the scientific aspects of each topics discussed every week. I loved the videos by Emiliana and Dacher.  Even though the videos are pre recorded, I could very easily connect with the topics as these two delivered the complex knowledge in simple words passionately for the subject. Course content was very vast,but the videos were very effective. I enjoyed listening to the videos and how they summarized different topics in few mins. Even though I could not participate in any discussions forum due to time constraints, I enjoyed reading each and every bit of it. For a person like me who was studying after a long gap of 25 yrs, it was a very well defined course, it wasn't too lengthy, yet it covered all the important aspects of happiness. The optional reading is there for me to enjoy later as I could not finish it during the limited time available . I truely appreciate the accessibility to shared resources like links to various research papers, videos which has helped me to enrich my knowledge of  these topics.i want to Thank the Greater Good Science Center for providing this wornderful course online ! I want to thank Dacher and Emiliana for their thoughtful insights into the matter. This course has definitely inspired me to read more and do more for happiness . I will definitely like to participate  in different opportunities available for contribution in Greater Good Science Center.THANKS A LOT!!
Course_Changes_TEXT: Nothing, I think this course is appropriate for online students!

Week 7: Mental Habits of Happiness,Week 8: Gratitude,Week 3: Kindness & Compassion,Week 6: Mindfulness,Week 9: Finding Your Happiness Fit & New Frontiers,Week 1: Introduction to the Science of Happiness,Week 2: The Power of Social Connection,Week 4: Cooperation & Reconciliation
Applied_to_life_TEXT: I have applied all of the practice exercises at least once.  Several I now do on a regular basis.  Generally I feels much happier and fulfilled in my life.  I feel like I have more purpose in the direction I am taking.  I am in the middle of a career change which can alter all of this, but I do feel like it has accelerated the positive feelings that have gone along with this major shift in my life instead of focusing on the negative aspects.  In September I got behind because my daughter in law had a new child and I went back east to help with the family.  When I returned I had some other things come up with job interviews and things.  But I felt like this was so important that I forced myself to catch up at the same time taking time to purposefully practice the various parts of the program.  It really has helped me, my kids and friends have noticed a change.  I have a couple of job offers and life is good.  Three years ago my former husband left with the 12 year younger neighbor after 32 years of marriage.  I finally feel like life is good and I am better off and I attribute a large boost towards that from the class in the last few months.  So thank you for helping me look forward in a positive way and be happy about going on with my life.  :-)

Week 7: Mental Habits of Happiness,Week 8: Gratitude,Week 3: Kindness & Compassion,Week 6: Mindfulness,Week 9: Finding Your Happiness Fit & New Frontiers,Week 1: Introduction to the Science of Happiness,Week 2: The Power of Social Connection,Week 4: Cooperation & Reconciliation
Applied_to_life_TEXT: I tried all the practices before and during the course, tried to use all the tips (like active listening, self-compassion, random acts of kindness, gratitude and so on) in daily life. I am actually trying to make those habits and practice all the time in my relationship with myself and others. I have been constantly discussing all the topics from the course with my family, friends and colleagues.
Impact_TEXT: I feel more compassionate and kind to myself, my family members and colleagues. I can see now people around me as gifts and hard situations as interesting quests for personal growth (at least trying to remind myself about this intention :)). It allows me feel calmer and more mindful and work and together with colleagues with whom I don't have many common interests. It allowed me to find many more people who share my vision and I got so much support suddenly from them. It literally feels like a new chapter in my life about what I am extremely happy. I could probably write pages of the text about all the fantastic episodes which happened to me during the past 11 weeks related to this course and about wonderful feelings and emotions, about my insights. At this point I would really like to mention that now I am looking for a possibility how to share this knowledge with other people, how to help them to get these necessary skills to experience more happiness and love in their lives. Thank you so much! I am extremely grateful for this fantastic course!!!!!
Forums_Community_TA_TEXT: Not really, cannot think about any specific posts.
Forums_NO_TEXT: did not have much time for online discussions
Value_TEXT: I have been studying mindfulness for almost 4 years already, therefore the material on this topic was already quite familiar.
Course_Like_Most_TEXT: A combination of psychology and neurobiology. Since I have a PhD in developmental neurobiology, it was important to me to understand the mechanisms behind certain emotions or patterns of behaviour.

Course_Changes_TEXT: Nothing, it is excellent for a broad audience as it is. As a neuroscientist now I have all the necessary information and links to deepen my knowledge in the areas I am more interested in.

Course_Like_Most_TEXT:
There were many interesting readings and the happiness practices were described well and made easy to understand and practice.
The course mentions obvious things, but to read about positive feelings and happiness in itself brings a smile and reinforces good habits (like reading often that one must eat more greens and exercise).
edx_Changes_TEXT: I think the course platform is fine as it is. Aesthetically, the layout of the check-ins could be a bit prettier.
Course_Changes_TEXT:
The "smiley/anxious/angry faces" didn't work very well for me. Some of them I couldn't confidently tell what state of mind and feelings were conveying exactly. I would try to use more standardized emoticons or get rid of that altogether.
Also, the feedback about the happiness practices: it is fine to ask if one has tried and how often, but every time to have to rate how that impacted you after only one week is pointless, in my opinion. I felt like it was repetitive and wasting my time.

Weeks_Completed: Week 7: Mental Habits of Happiness,Week 8: Gratitude,Week 3: Kindness & Compassion,Week 6: Mindfulness,Week 9: Finding Your Happiness Fit & New Frontiers,Week 1: Introduction to the Science of Happiness,Week 2: The Power of Social Connection,Week 4: Cooperation & Reconciliation
Applied_to_life_TEXT:
I have watched all the videos, read all the reading, sometimes extra reading when I had special interest.
I took note (fill three notebooks) I had to make a bilingual vocabulary as I am not an English native speaker and I found some of the terms used very challenging.
I tried all the practice, except one that I found too challenging for me: The best self. And it confused me because I am trying hard to be in the present moment and suddenly I am asked to be in the future. And my life has shown me that plan never happen. So I tend not to do none as I don t want to be disappointed.  I stay open to anything that can happen. But the difficulty I encountered with this task make me reflect and I am thinking I should challenge myself and do it... sometime...
Impact_TEXT:
Most of the content in the course was quite obvious for me.
Nevertheless a few things really impacted on me:
1- The influence of prime caregiver on how people develop relationships: secure vs insecure
2- The understanding of the plasticity of the brain and my choice to decide which part of my brain I want to develop has a big impact of my understanding of the importance of my life choices.
3- Gratefulness is something I was not paying much attention on. Definitely something I am going to develop in my future.
4- As a teacher in an International school, there are definitely some practoces and ideas I want to develop further with my students and colleagues.
Forums_Community_TA_TEXT: not really. I registered very late in a group. I posted a comment and did not go back. Actually I would have liked to have feedback if someone replied to my ideas. like an email or some kind of alert
Forums_NO_TEXT: I participated a few times but found it very frustrating. Mainly because the post were from the more ancient to the newest. And everybody read the first post , nobody read the last ones... and nobody read mine because I was late. I strongly suggest to put them in reverse chronological order to get everybody have the opportunity to be read. Most of the post were boring and did bring nothing to my study.
Value_TEXT:
I enjoyed almost all videos and reading.
week 6: I did not like the text with the police story. It as too long, complicated, boring.
week 9: Awe was interesting. I found it a bit superficial in the other subjects: laugh, play and especially the narrative. An article about creative play would have been welcome.
Course_Like_Most_TEXT: That it kept me enthusiast and happy and I felt I spread this happiness around me, inspiring people
edx_Changes_TEXT:
when people make a post, publish them from the newest to the ancient one. If someone reply to a post, inform the person who wrote the first post (alert, email...) 
If you want to make the discussions more alive, promote the interaction by alerting people.
Course_Changes_TEXT: I am very surprised it is very psycho-oriented and I feel it lacks some science on how the sun (through vitamin D), exercise, environment (pollution) and especially the food... are affecting happiness. I kind of understand it is secondary but I am not sure about it... Isn't intestine the second brain? What does the science says about it?

Impact_TEXT: It has been an extremely stressful time while undertaking this - 1) watching the world go down a self destructive path, politically, 2) evacuating for a hurricane that struck our home, 3) dealing with yet another recurrence from my incurable cancer.  Yet, despite the difficulties, the subject area and practices of the course have helped me to maintain happiness in the face of difficulty.  Quite a feat.
Forums_Community_TA_TEXT: No
Forums_NO_TEXT: Did minimal.  Not my preferred way of communicating.
Value_TEXT: This was an extremely well- organized course.  I have completed 6 MOOCs, and until disabled by cancer was a university professor myself.  So, it is with a certain degree of authority and experience that I rate the material "extremely valuable".  Love the choices of subject matter for each week, and the way they build and relate to each other.  Thank you
Course_Like_Most_TEXT: Course material and organization
Course_Changes_TEXT: It's already excellent.  Just update as new material comes along.  Please continue to offer this course.  And thanks for keeping the archives available.  I plan to repeat, to let it sink in more. And to dig deeper into the selected recommendations provided for further inquiry.

Applied_to_life_TEXT:
While I have not applied all the practices to my life I want to look into them more and alter my life in increments to set myself up for success. 

The biggest element I have taken away from this course is the definition of forgiveness. My father was abusive and my childhood terrifying. However, he changed so I can't hate him as who he was no longer exists. Until now I though of forgiveness as letting him get away with the behaviour or condoning it. Now I am more understanding of why he did what he did and that letting go is good for me.
Impact_TEXT: Mostly learning to live in the moment.

Applied_to_life_TEXT: I have tried to complete all the happiness practices presented in the course and have offered many of my clients the opportunity to benefit from them too
Impact_TEXT: I am a psychologist in private practice. I enrolled in the course for a number of reasons including those above. I have benefitted from the information and the practices/strategies I learnt in this course both in managing my personal and work related stress, attending more closely to my relationships and particularly in extending the range of offerings I have for my clients who are often if not always looking to develop strategies to relax, improve mood and relationships and build resilience. I have also included the course in the CPD I must fulfil for registration.
Course_Like_Most_TEXT: Incredibly informative in terms of the science and knowledge of happiness and, importantly in the practical strategies that can be implemented to increase happiness. The mode of delivery was spot on!!

Week 7: Mental Habits of Happiness,Week 8: Gratitude,Week 3: Kindness & Compassion,Week 6: Mindfulness,Week 9: Finding Your Happiness Fit & New Frontiers,Week 1: Introduction to the Science of Happiness,Week 2: The Power of Social Connection,Week 4: Cooperation & Reconciliation
Impact_TEXT:
I have applied my new knowledge particularly in my interactions with my sons.  Some of the practices like the meditation and the gratitude journal I have been practicing with my oldest son, he is now keeping one.  I am trying to live more mindfully, I have gone back to my yoga practices that I had stopped for over a year, due to lack of time and also lack of information about how crucial they are for developing mindfulness and therefore happiness. I went back last sunday and enjoyed every second of it.
My oldest son and I have watched some videos together.  I am looking for spaces in my routine for doing things that bring me happiness. I give more value to gratitude and try to exercise it every day.
In general I have hugely expanded my understanding of happiness and I am 100% convinced that change is possible to live a meaningful life for me and especially for my two kids and husband, as being myself happy will definitely make them happier, I also have now so many tools to help them be truly happy and satisfied and just enjoy life.

Weeks_Completed: Week 7: Mental Habits of Happiness,Week 8: Gratitude,Week 3: Kindness & Compassion,Week 6: Mindfulness,Week 9: Finding Your Happiness Fit & New Frontiers,Week 1: Introduction to the Science of Happiness,Week 2: The Power of Social Connection,Week 4: Cooperation & Reconciliation
Applied_to_life_TEXT: As all the books are limited to acces, I've tried to read lots of articles even on the Greater Good Sciences Center and academic journals aswell. Also, all of the videos were highly informative and inspiring.
Impact_TEXT:
As an ex- corporate person and an (older ) PhD Student in Interpersonal Communication which is a broadly multidisciplinary area in social sciences, I believe that this course gave a new direction to my research focus. I'm happy to find happiness which might be one of the core components of a healthy interpersonal communication. Besides academic advancement, happiness practices- including articles, books, videos- that we took in the class tended to create a permanent pathways for my personal life, even in my family and social environment.

In sum, I feel a real "flow" while taking this course, Thank you,
Forums_NO_TEXT: More often, because of my limited time. As lessons take time, needed to balancing with my personal life, mostly my family and my academic works. So, discussion forums was not in my top priorities according to my daily workload. But if I could have time, I would definitely participate. Thank you:)
Value_TEXT:
In Week 1 , historical and scieentfic perspectives and happiness definitions was informative and valuable for me, 
In week 2, emphaty and relationships gave a new direction to my researches, 
In week 3, to hear aboud Zimbardo's new reseach on Heroism - online heroism is one of my research focus- was significant. 

In week 4,  Evolutionary roots of cooperation, ( evolutionary view to happines in total) was informative, 
In week 6, mindfullness from the beggining to the end was remarkable, 
Inweek 7,  "Flow" was inspiring ,
In week 8: totally valuable , informative, 
In week 9, awe and personal fit in hapiness practices was helpfull ,
Exams: Exams were valuable and reinforced
Course_Like_Most_TEXT: I wouldn't expect this kind of scientific base in the course. Although I'm familiar with lots of concepts, it was the first time that I've learned about scientific roots of meditation and mindfulness.
edx_Changes_TEXT: It would be better if there is a "back" button for surveys to go back to earlier questions.
Course_Changes_TEXT: An advanced level course for professionals would be fantastic. As a researcher and academic on Interpersonal Communication, I must say that, The Science of Happiness going to give a new direction to my scientific journey.

Week 7: Mental Habits of Happiness,Week 8: Gratitude,Week 3: Kindness & Compassion,Week 6: Mindfulness,Week 9: Finding Your Happiness Fit & New Frontiers,Week 1: Introduction to the Science of Happiness,Week 2: The Power of Social Connection,Week 4: Cooperation & Reconciliation
Impact_TEXT:
I enjoyed this class because I was able to do it at my own pace and it seemed to apply to me in terms how I live and how I want to continue living. For example, I set aside at least 1-hour most days to work on the course material. It became part of my daily routine with my other course work and responsibilities. 

For me, this course combined aspects of learning (through readings and videos) and journaling (through discussions). I liked the combination of reading the articles provided and then applying them to my own experiences and opinions through thought provoking scenarios and discussions. 

Lastly, this course helped me connect more with my own positive thoughts and behavior and it helped me feel connected to scholars and the UCB community.

Course_Like_Most_TEXT: I liked the weekly topics, videos, e-mail reminders and readings.

Weeks_Completed: Week 7: Mental Habits of Happiness,Week 8: Gratitude,Week 3: Kindness & Compassion,Week 6: Mindfulness,Week 9: Finding Your Happiness Fit & New Frontiers,Week 1: Introduction to the Science of Happiness,Week 2: The Power of Social Connection,Week 4: Cooperation & Reconciliation
Forums_NO_TEXT: I was always a chap[ter or two behind everyone else. When I did participate, it was more like writing to myself.,
Value_TEXT: Each chapter was so much more than I anticipated they would be. I found practical uses for most if not all of the information each week, each held a great deal of value, since I could apply they directly to m\y life.
Course_Like_Most_TEXT: All the science behind the information, proving the value of its worth and the practical ways to use and achieve happiness. I was able to apply it directly to my everyday life and share the info with others to help them,. I have said to others how great it is and think it should be a required course for all humans living in society.
edx_Changes_TEXT: There was a lot more time invested, then I  had originally thought, which was probably me just taking the time to absorb it. So, letting people know that while it can be done in maybe 4 hours a week, it may take some longer than that, so they can plan for it.
Course_Changes_TEXT: At this time, I cannot think of anything. I wish I could have attended one of thew live sessions, but due to my work schedule, I could not. The live Q&A I did not know it was happening until it was over. Maybe pre-class instruction could let people know that these things could be happening. I was not able to open the emails from the course, don't know why, probably my phone or something, so that was frustrating to me. Don't think there is anything you guys could do differently about that.

Why_Not_Complete_TEXT: I did compete all the videos reading and quizzes in the cours. I didn't complete most of the happiness practices because of time and I wanted to complete the final exam before the deadline. I will be going back to do the happiness practices that most interest me at my own pace.
Applied_to_life_TEXT: Increasing my gratitude
Course_Like_Most_TEXT: I had a negative connatation of positive psychology prior to the course and that completely changed
