Happiness_Team_Name: Talent And Genius Squad - Entrepreneurs, consultants, coaches
Team_TEXT: We didn't really take off as a team!
Team_Suggestions_TEXT: It would be great if the platform was set up to send notifications. Or instead to use a Slack team or something easier to do.
Course_Like_Most_TEXT:
the information was very comprehensive, it was taught in plain English, and it really sought to help us be more happy... not just address theoretical topics. I loved it!
I also loved how I could speed up the videos, that helped me complete the course on time. I was worried I wouldn't have enough time to get it all done but I did!
edx_Changes_TEXT: I'd love a mobile app... getting logged in from my mobile phone was a little challenging. I found it easier to do the course from my laptop.

Weeks_Completed: Week 7: Mental Habits of Happiness,Week 8: Gratitude,Week 3: Kindness & Compassion,Week 6: Mindfulness,Week 9: Finding Your Happiness Fit & New Frontiers,Week 1: Introduction to the Science of Happiness,Week 2: The Power of Social Connection,Week 4: Cooperation & Reconciliation
Forums_NO_TEXT: Sometimes, it was because I was late doing that particular module so I didn't think others would see it; sometimes because I just barely had time to complete the material and needed to finish.
Course_Like_Most_TEXT: Got caught up with the research in the field and got a good understanding of the science.
edx_Changes_TEXT: It worked very well.
Course_Changes_TEXT: Some of the topics included too much research so that it became cumbersome. I think you should select the best and then offer the others as "more info". The fact that each section went on and on made it feel overwhelming (it definitely took more time for me to complete than was described by Emiliana in the beginning - and I'm a fast reader and know a lot about this work). I did feel I wanted/needed to finish all that was put in front of me. I felt the same way about the practices. These often take a good bit of time to make an impact - by the time I got into one, the next one (or more!) was offered. I almost felt nauseous about it (you might be able to tell I have a bit of perfectionism in me :) Overall the material was excellent - it's just a lot more material and activity than can be fit into this time frame...

Course_Changes_TEXT: On an average it took close to 8 hours for me to complete the weekly schedules. Content is very heavy. So, for a slow reader like me, i think additional weeks should be added and content distributed evenly between these weeks. Otherwise, we will be blindly rushing to finish the course without applying or understanding what we have learn.

Week 7: Mental Habits of Happiness,Week 8: Gratitude,Week 3: Kindness & Compassion,Week 6: Mindfulness,Week 9: Finding Your Happiness Fit & New Frontiers,Week 1: Introduction to the Science of Happiness,Week 2: The Power of Social Connection,Week 4: Cooperation & Reconciliation
Applied_to_life_TEXT:
I was introduced to this class from my mentor at work who previously was a student. We are creating a new medical school where we are very interested and focused on our students as human beings and helping them grow and thrive in this environment rather than experience what so many have encountered previously. The intentionality of the creation of this school led to the position I am in as Director of Wellness & Integrative Medicine. 

The speakers and readings from this class were each excellent and informative as I create this curriculum. I plan on including some of this material where possible for our students. I love how Dacher & Emiliana focused their lives and research on the positive aspects rather than the deficits we so often see. This class opened my eyes in so many ways. The exercises were particularly challenging. In the forgiveness exercise, I felt old wounds re-open. Through the context of self-discovery from this course and where I am in my life today, it was really interesting to experience all of those old emotions while viewing them through a new lens. I often would talk with my husband about the course and what we were doing and it was extremely valuable for our marriage as well. 

Last week, I had the pleasure of meeting with and talking to Dr. Stuart Brown and his science of play. I mentioned to him that I was enrolled in your course and he had the kindest of words about you and your work. I am excited by the groundswell of like-minded people working together to create changes in this world. Thank you for creating this class. I am forever changed by the experience of this.
Forums_NO_TEXT: Time was the biggest factor for not participating in these.
Happiness_Team_Name: I signed up to be on one, but never participated as such
Course_Like_Most_TEXT: The exposure to the thoughtful content.

Weeks_Completed: Week 7: Mental Habits of Happiness,Week 8: Gratitude,Week 3: Kindness & Compassion,Week 6: Mindfulness,Week 9: Finding Your Happiness Fit & New Frontiers,Week 1: Introduction to the Science of Happiness,Week 2: The Power of Social Connection,Week 4: Cooperation & Reconciliation
Applied_to_life_TEXT: I have lived with the monks in the Himalayas for a long time. A lot of these practices I do already. I still didn't keep up the journal and all the other techniques suggested on the course as they are at times 'laborious' and a bit artificial. The monks' practices were more internal, and somehow more natural - at least for me! Still found plenty to learn on the course - great job guys! Loved it thoroughly :)
Forums_NO_TEXT: Too much information and not enough structure around them. Seemed like lots of individual expressions (sometimes repeated) and not enough coordination!
Course_Like_Most_TEXT: Well designed and extremely interesting. Like I said I already had some good grounding in kindness, compassion etc. and hence most of your ideas resonated. Some of them were rather "westernized" (if I may say so) but I can see their usefulness. Learnt lots, esp the scientific research into happiness - fascinating!
edx_Changes_TEXT: The discussion forums could be moderated, where you could potentially have broad categories of ideas (say 4 different options per discussion) and probably have 1 post per category and have us all comment on that one post. Makes it more structured I suppose. Just an idea!
Course_Changes_TEXT: I'd have loved to see some more of the Eastern practices in their pure form. Also, I did have some misgivings about some facts presented (e.g. feeling detached from your thoughts does not work the same as some of the other practices)... In India (and eastern mysticism in general), we acknowledge that different paths lead to the same outcome, and depending on an individual's temperament, he/ she selects (or is selected) by the right path. Agree that you brought this out in the last lesson - so good job overall :D

Applied_to_life_TEXT: i have tried to apply gratitude,active listening & self compassionate with my son,husband,relatives & collugues to some extent i have also applied act of forgiveness 7 made may literature utilized for my relationship
Value_TEXT: i use to wait for tuesday very excitedly that what new things i am goig to learn the scientifc evidences,the resarches the course is really wonderful i am lucky enough to be a part of it on time

Why_Not_Complete_TEXT: I thought it would be less time consuming. It was weird for me to observe I started being stressed dealing with shortage of time when it comes to this course, especially taking into account the fact I was doing it just for myself, to feel happier. Thus, I decided to choose only some articles, not taking the whole course as it is as I, instead of taking a befit of it, started to think how much I didn't go through. That was something that surprised me a lot and gave me a lot of inside about myself and what I should really work on. Thank you :)
Applied_to_life_TEXT: Since I didn't go through the whole course, I applied only some things coming from materials I went through: gratitude exercise: to write down what you are grateful for at the end of the day, paying attention to wandering mind and working on being focused in daily activities.
Impact_TEXT: I love the community of people sharing positive stories on fb. Every time I checked my fb I was flooded with such positive stories that I started to feel more connected to people all around me. That was something I didn't expect and was surprising to me.
Forums_NO_TEXT: I just didn't feel the need of participating. Poor but honest answer.

Weeks_Completed: Week 7: Mental Habits of Happiness,Week 8: Gratitude,Week 3: Kindness & Compassion,Week 6: Mindfulness,Week 9: Finding Your Happiness Fit & New Frontiers,Week 1: Introduction to the Science of Happiness,Week 2: The Power of Social Connection,Week 4: Cooperation & Reconciliation
Applied_to_life_TEXT: I am currently pursuing mindfulness facilitating certification at the University of Toronto and I have found themes between this and GG101x to have many similarities.  Professionally, GG101x has provided me with a generous amount of new information that will go a long way in influencing the well-rounded and balanced nature of the mindfulness workshop I intend on creating upon certification. Personally, I found the material to have great flow and, while I did not successfully complete all of the weekly practices, the ones I did engage in did, in fact, bring me some measure of happiness.  I plan to continue developing habits of happiness and finding my best "fit" so that I may completely embody the experience of mindful happiness for self and others.  Thank you!
Impact_TEXT: Personally, I feel more confident and in control of my own happiness because of my new understanding of the mechanisms and themes in the state and process of happiness.  In particular, I have noticed an increase in my compassion for others and this is probably linked to my increased compassion for self.  All areas of my life are and will receive benefit of my increased levels of happiness.
Forums_NO_TEXT: it was more a timing thing.  Fitting in the course itself into my schedule was challenging enough but I couldn't afford to spend time getting involved in discussions, as much as I would have liked to participate.  I do intend on going back and reading them in any case.
Course_Like_Most_TEXT: I loved the thoroughness of the material and the breadth of topics.  Watching Emiliana and Dacher's videos were great! They are both warm and feel more like friends than relative strangers! This course has given me a platform for expanding my personal growth and professional growth and I have frequently taken advantage of recommended readings to further my understanding in certain areas.
edx_Changes_TEXT: provide more quality courses, like GG101x, in the human sciences, like neuroplasticity and mindfulness
Course_Changes_TEXT: I loved it! I can't really think of anything except that I preferred the checklist question type over the simpler multiple choice questions as a means of more thoroughly testing my knowledge of the material.  I also think there should be more questions per topic.  In other words a little more challenging in the testing aspect.

Applied_to_life_TEXT: I have applied some of the strategies learned from the course to improve the happiness in my life and in the life of my friends and family. I'm being more mindfulness, very often I write about the three good things and I do more active listening. The course opened my mind and my horizons. I shared some of the concepts with my twin sister who developed a disease because the stress and she is happier with some of the practices here. I'm very grateful for helping her.
Impact_TEXT: The course brought me the vison that I've need to understand better my own personal happiness and how I can help others to be happy and how I can transform my community in a happy way. I'm very grateful for that.
Forums_NO_TEXT: Sorry, I choose the incorrect answer before. How can I fix that? Value_TEXT: Every week I felt myself excited about the topic and motivated to learn more about a happy and meaningful life.
Course_Like_Most_TEXT: Learn about how build a happy and meaningful world, beginning with my own personal happiness and collaborating with the happiness around me, transforming people, community and the world.

Applied_to_life_TEXT: In myself, by practicing happiness practices. And also, talking to my friends, relatives and even the people in my job, just by talking to them I can see how they open they mind to the science of happiness, and how willing they are to hear about how to improve their happiness.
Impact_TEXT: I have would say that by paying attention to something in my life sometime ago, and by taking this course, my happiness baseline has increased a lot. I wake up in the morning feeling happy, knowing that there will be a lot of things to do during the day that may be not good, or will not make me happy, but I know that I can overcome them. Also I can feel how my attitude makes an influence on the people around me, that makes people around me feel good as well as myself!

I've learned a lot with every topic, even thou I had read about some subjects before, seeing them here together with the others, made me saw them from another point of view.

Weeks_Completed: Week 3: Kindness & Compassion,Week 1: Introduction to the Science of Happiness,Week 2: The Power of Social Connection,Week 4: Cooperation & Reconciliation
Why_Not_Complete: There was a change in my life circumstance
Why_Not_Complete_TEXT:
It actually isn't meant to be a reflection on the quality of the course at all, I still think it's brilliant and am grateful that it has been made available to me free of charge.
Part of my reason for halting was a sudden spike in workload and then changes in my personal circumstances that felt life threatening to me. I think you mention somewhere in the course that if you feel under threat, you forget the finer points of living well. This has been the case for me. I stopped because the life you live in a poor country distracts you from who you are, not because the work you guys did was crap.
I still think the course has immense emotional value and especially when the threat has passed will help me get back to a more even keel. I wish the people involved in compiling the course a blessed holiday season and some rest that you thoroughly deserve. You did a fantastic job on this course!
Applied_to_life_TEXT:
For me it wasn't about a specific technique. It was the realisation that having emotional ups and downs is normal and wanted and even that it makes for a rich life. I was stuck in the mindset that you address in the course that I couldn't call myself happy unless I was ecstatic all the time. I didn't realise how unsustainable that is.
Even though I didn't finish the material has put things in perspective for me and also knowing now there are other people in the world who want to make things better has made me feel less alone. Your gift to me has been fortitude.
Forums_Community_TA_TEXT: It makes you feel supported when they interact with you, it feels like you're in a class discussing matters.
Forums_NO_TEXT: Certain areas of the material made me want to say something or hear what others think and reading others' thoughts also inspired me to think differently about things.
Value_TEXT: Just in general the material was relevant and thought provoking.
Course_Like_Most_TEXT:
The friendly tone of the speakers on the video, the way they bring their enthusiasm for the topic across.
The richness of the material. Usually when something is free it's done as a teaser to get you to spend money. This was a course I would expect to pay a lot of money for.
edx_Changes_TEXT: Perhaps have a sidebar that suggests related courses.
Course_Changes_TEXT: Absolutely nothing :D

Weeks_Completed: Week 7: Mental Habits of Happiness,Week 8: Gratitude,Week 3: Kindness & Compassion,Week 6: Mindfulness,Week 9: Finding Your Happiness Fit & New Frontiers,Week 1: Introduction to the Science of Happiness,Week 2: The Power of Social Connection,Week 4: Cooperation & Reconciliation
Applied_to_life_TEXT:
As a human resources professional and certified life coach, I have used the knowledge gained in my discussions with coworkers and clients. I have also recalled information when conversing with friends and family members as it applied to our conversations. 
The unit on Gratitude was especially helpful to me in my personal life, as it helped me connect in a deeper way with this very important personal value.
I am intrigued by the research findings on the relationship of brain function and happiness, and it has helped me view others in my life in a more non-judgmental and understanding way.
Forums_NO_TEXT: I didn't participate in all of the forums due to time constraints, but when I did participate I found it beneficial to read others' views and experiences with the material. It helped bring the material from the classroom to the real world and also made me feel like part of a larger learning community.
Course_Like_Most_TEXT: As a lifelong learner, I was thrilled with the opportunity to access high quality content at no charge and in a format that was convenient for me. I am grateful to Emiliana and Dacher for their willingness to offer this MOOC.
edx_Changes_TEXT: Easier access to the course materials without having to click through the menu or the content bar at the top of the page. Sometimes I found it hard to quickly return to a particular video or article for review. Also, I did not have the ability to modify the speed of videos when viewing on my iPad.
Course_Changes_TEXT: Since I often accessed the content while driving, it would have been helpful to me to have an audio version of the articles that I could listen to. It was more of a challenge to find time to read than to listen to the content.

I also would like to create a greater good team in the NYC area with a team of people dedicated to implementing the material learned throughout the class. Why_Not_Complete_TEXT: I lost my job and dealing with that had an impact on my ability to focus on the course.  I am very fortunate to be a reasonably optimistic and happy person & I expect to complete the course over the next few weeks.  It's a good course!

Value_TEXT: I started this course as a "doubting Thomas:"  I thought it was going to be a little too woo-woo for me, but I followed the course advice and approached it with an open mind.  The course reinforced some things I suspected and did a great job explaining the physiology that connects mind and body.  (that was fascinating!!!!)   So, bottom line, each week that I completed was valuable and built on the previous week.  You guys did a GREAT job putting this free class together & it is awesome.  Thank you very much!!
Course_Like_Most_TEXT: The variety!!!!!   You all did a great job of mixing short and long videos, speakers, written material and providing additional reading and research options.  It was GREAT---seriously it wasn't boring!!!   The course was compelling and inspired my curiosity; it was obvious that a great deal of hard work went into the course.  I really appreciate it---thank you!!!

Applied_to_life_TEXT:
I have tried to focus on positive experiences and am trying to help my children do the same. 
My son is terrified of school-tests and I have tried to help motivate and encourage him in a diffirent way after taking the course. I feel he's more at ease with the testing now than he was earlier, and hope that as he grows older he roll become better at coping with tests. 
I try to meditate every day and have tried to do a body-scan with my children. I feel they are more relaxed and sleep better when ending the day with a body-scan. 
I have tried to tell my friend whip suffers from damage from a concussion about benefits of meditation, so far it has not eorked - she says her head is full of thoughts and she feels stupid doing it...
Forums_NO_TEXT: I found it hard to navigate.
Value_TEXT: To me the 1st week, the subject on forgiving and mindfulness were most interesting. In recent years I've heard a lot about being mindful, but thought of it as some 'trending word' after having followed the course I understand what's behind.
Course_Like_Most_TEXT:
When I first signed up I did because I thought it could be fun. It has been so much more. I have been on a journey where I've learned so much about myself. 
I like that you can participate as much as you wish, though some of the stuff is somewhat complicated neuro-physiological information you make it accessible to us. 
I learned a lot about forgiveness- in my personal definition it meant acceptance. That was an eye-opener for me, and I spent a lot of time on that subject. 
The videos are usually short enough so you can watch them without having to spend too much time -very nice for watching when commuting ! 
I had no doubt throughout the course, that everyone involved knows what they're talking about- very competent group of people. 
Thank you.

edx_Changes_TEXT: As I was completing this survey, I clicked "Next" by mistake instead of the ">>" button and now I don't know what happened to all the previous input. (So I am going to re-type a short comment - I found that the "3 Good Things" actually did give me a happiness boost.)
Course_Changes_TEXT: I clicked "no" on would I recommend this course to others, because I did invited six friends to take it but they all didn't have time. As I worked on the course myself, I started out with taking a lot of time for the first 3 weeks of course material, but then began to feel bogged down and so started skimming the material more. I seems like only psychology students or unemployed people would have the time and motivation to complete this course due to the large amount of material and time investment required. Maybe you could have two versions: "Deep Science of Happiness" and then a much shortened version "Ways to Practice Happiness" (for all those people who have less time). Also, It seems like social connection is a main component of happiness, so I am wondering if there could be more help for people who struggle to maintain social connection or who feel a sense of dis-satisfaction with the kind of social connections that they have.

Weeks_Completed: Week 7: Mental Habits of Happiness,Week 8: Gratitude,Week 3: Kindness & Compassion,Week 6: Mindfulness,Week 9: Finding Your Happiness Fit & New Frontiers,Week 1: Introduction to the Science of Happiness,Week 4: Cooperation & Reconciliation
Why_Not_Complete: I had less time than I thought I would
Why_Not_Complete_TEXT: Change of life circumstances: applying for a new job, looking for a new flat in a new city, lots of planning involved in these changes etc. --> left me with less time and above all less energy at the end of many days than I anticipated
Applied_to_life_TEXT:
Haven't tried a lot of the exercises (yet), to be honest. What i did do is: I tried being more mindful in my life (however, admittedly, I already had a little experience with mindfulness in the past, before starting this course. But the course strengthened my resolve to start being more mindful again), I tried to be more grateful and tried to "see" more things in my daily life to be grateful for, I tried to forgive two people who have hurt me in the past (meaning: stop holding a grudge against them, sending them good thoughts ("may you live with ease, may you be happy, may you be free from pain"))
All in all I haven't done a lot of the things suggested in the course so far, but the ones I did, I was quite successful in, in my opinion ... which makes me feel grateful - mainly for the course which helped me do these things
Forums_NO_TEXT: I didn't participate mainly because I completed most of the course in the last two weeks of November (I am a procrastinator + had more stress during the course time than anticipated before)
Course_Like_Most_TEXT:
The Videos: Emiliana and Dacher are amazing speakers. Talking speed, intonation, frequency of smiles, facial expression in general etc. - without exaggerating, in my opinion it's really close to perfection what Emiliana and Dacher do in the videos (but they don't seem too professional, by the way, quite on the contrary, they seem very likeable, like people I'd really love to meet and chat with). 
Kudos Emiliana and Dacher!
edx_Changes_TEXT: Nothing, really. Everything (like navigation, for example) is very intuitive, in my opinion
Course_Changes_TEXT:
The questions in the problemsets and exams: I get that you don't want to make it too difficult, because scoring low would make people feel bad and probably discourage them from continuing the course and engaging with the contents in general. And you are right, it definitely shouldn't be too difficult. However, many of the questions (or, well, not the questions, but the answers you can choose from) are so glaringly obvious that I often only skimmed through the questions and answer options without really thinking about the topics. I experienced the questions often like this: "What effect does positive practice xy have according to expert z?" Answer options: three with a negative effect and one with a positive effect --> so, of course, it is the only one with the positive effect. It was the same with the checkbox questions: in most cases you could just choose either all the positive outcomes or all the negative outcomes, depending on what the question asked for.
Without wanting to be too arrogant, but I think, that even without doing any of the course work, I could have easily had a score of 80%+. Which made the questions kind of moot, in my opinion (at least for myself).

Often in the course, there are videos and then text or an article to read below it. A couple of times I had the feeling, that the text below the video more or less only repeated what was said in the video. That kind of repeating the same information several times in direct succession bored me immensely (however, I'm a person who might have ADD and is generally low on attention and easily distracted, so i might not be representative). But I also didn't want to stop reading the text/article in fear of losing out/ missing something important...

Weeks_Completed: Week 7: Mental Habits of Happiness,Week 8: Gratitude,Week 3: Kindness & Compassion,Week 6: Mindfulness,Week 9: Finding Your Happiness Fit & New Frontiers,Week 1: Introduction to the Science of Happiness,Week 2: The Power of Social Connection,Week 4: Cooperation & Reconciliation
Why_Not_Complete: I had less time than I thought I would
Why_Not_Complete_TEXT: I didn't complete all of the tests but I did read all of the material, watch  all of the videos, discuss the ideas, and try all of the exercises ( although I completed those rather randomly due to increased unpredictability in my life).
Applied_to_life_TEXT: I have spent more time with others, participated in more group events, tried to be more generous and aware, express my gratitude more openly.
Impact_TEXT: Prior to the election I felt more trust in a group of people, volunteers, who have help me, personally, and the community in which I live in our recovery from a tornado that destroyed many homes in our area.  I am an artist and enjoy working alone, but after the initial shock of suddenly being surrounded by helpers, I made an effort to be part of the group, to accept the help that was offered with gratitude, and to be helpful to others in any way I could.  I was shocked to find that most of the volunteers I know are Trump supporters (only discovered that recently and am overwhelmed by the cognitive dissonance).  Their support of Trump seems totally at odds with the values I assumed them to hold based upon their behavior or the last 18 months.  I no longer feel a part of that group as I no longer feel any trust between us but I do feel closer to my long-time friends.  I'm recovering from a major disaster that occurred at about the same time as my old career had stalled and I was entering a new phase of life, namely 'old age' and not sure how to regard it.  I now find myself in far better physical circumstances then prior to the tornado, having been recommended to head a public art project that will develop my career in many new ways and give back to the community, and knowing that there are hosts of people ready to help strangers in need. I'm disappointed to find that many of the assumptions I'd like to make about others don't hold true, but will have to be reconciled to it and adjust my world view.
Forums_Community_TA_TEXT: don't recall content specifcally, saw a couple
Forums_NO_TEXT: 'Just wanted to post my thoughts.
Course_Like_Most_TEXT: I got a kick out of the idea that cooperation and kindness, etc. were important for our evolutionary survival.  My Dad always argued that without rigid social controls we would rape and pillage each other to the last man standing.
edx_Changes_TEXT: This is entirely personal, but I enjoy being alone, doing artwork, learning something new, enjoying Nature.  Social relationships definitely enhance my life but they are not central to it, nor central to my happiness.  I feel that the beginning of the course over-emphasized the importance of connection.

Why_Not_Complete_TEXT: It seemed to be a lot of bitty things saying the same thing over and over again. Very repetitive, and it seemed to take me ages to get nowhere.
Applied_to_life_TEXT: I suppose I thought about it a bit more, but it did seem to be very cerebral, somehow. I still feel isolated, am still grieving, still don't fit in, still feel lonely. Binge eat, binge internet, can't be bothered to clean my house or sort out the entropy - seems to be no point, as I am in my late sixties and people I like and love are dying. I expect if I could drag myself out of these addictions and put more effort into the course I would benefit from it. I hope you will leave the course up, because I would like to do that.
Impact_TEXT: Intellectually stimulating at times, but far too repetitive. As I said above, if I put more effort into it I feel sure I would benefit more.

Value_TEXT: I want to go back to it. I LOVE the idea of the course but I didn't make the effort when I had the opportunity.

edx_Changes_TEXT: None.
Course_Changes_TEXT: Make it less repetitive. More reminders? Understand that some participants don't have anyone to write about them - or (like me) don't want to ask anyone for fear of appearing self-obsessed or putting on them. Oh dear - you've caught me at a negative moment, haven't you? Sometimes I feel ecstatically happy - like this evening, sitting on the Beacon (the hill behind my house) looking at the beautiful sunset. At other times I feel devastatedly sad - like this evening, after the sun had set and I was walking back beneath a still-pink sky, wishing I had my beloved Clive to share it with still. And so it goes.

Weeks_Completed: Week 7: Mental Habits of Happiness,Week 8: Gratitude,Week 3: Kindness & Compassion,Week 6: Mindfulness,Week 9: Finding Your Happiness Fit & New Frontiers,Week 1: Introduction to the Science of Happiness,Week 2: The Power of Social Connection,Week 4: Cooperation & Reconciliation
Applied_to_life_TEXT: Gratitude practices, mindfulness practices, endeavouring to practice forgiveness and follow the format outlined in the course, engage even more often in awe-inspiring experiences (e.g. more nature walks, putting my phone down and just paying attention etc); self-compassion. I find that re-reading through the course notes leaves me feeling more positive and I've also noticed that I've become more focused and effective over the past couple of weeks.  In addition, I've shared relevant insights with others e.g. 4 horsemen of the apocalypse, learnings on apologising
Forums_Community_TA_TEXT: Yes, somewhat akin to the research finding that being primed to realise or recognise that happiness practices have positively impact ed on others. I found it uplifting, heart-warming and enjoyable reading through comments from others, particularly those from the TAs with more advanced knowledge. In fact, it has probably even further piqued my desire to dig deeper into this data. And, if the option were available, I would be very keen to pursue an MA in positive psych at Berkeley (distance learning though as I live in Ireland!)
Forums_NO_TEXT: In general, I read more than I wrote however, I did comment a few times.
Value_TEXT: I found the first week the most taxing at the time. however, in revising for the exam, I realised how valuable the insights / history / context were. As repetition strengths those neural pathways so I particularly liked the approach of a mid-term exam with the revision summaries. All of the weeks were practical and, for me, I greatly appreciate the deep sharing of research findings, video presentations from Dacher and Emiliana and the guest lecturers. I genuinely appreciated every week's content and, if there was one, that I leave eager to have spent more time on, it would be attachment theory. Further, there was just one article that I did not appreciate - the article by Michael Kosfeld. I found his comments on marketers to be distracting, judgmental and unfair. Whilst I am a marketer and thus could be accused of defensiveness (!!), I have worked for some of the world's biggest brands and we have never employed such intentionally manipulative strategies. I realise he is actually a business lecturer, rather than a psychologist, and still find it unkind.
Course_Like_Most_TEXT: Relevant and practical nature, breadth of knowledge, level of scientific research shared, calibre of course leaders and guest speakers. I believe this course truly has the potential to positively impact on anyone who embarks upon it. I would love if there was a follow-on course (even a paid one) to continue and deepen my knowledge in this field.
edx_Changes_TEXT: When the Happiness Practices are shared, it includes information on why this works, the following page is usually a Why and How page and normally is almost entirely repetitive. I would suggest removing that page. I would appreciate if some of the articles were downloadable / could be saved onto laptops for further reading. That said, I'm aware that they are all available on the Greater Good Science Centre website.
Course_Changes_TEXT: Run a stage 2 course! Run the second Q&A even closer to the exam, I realise it was around Nov 3rd but I was not up to date at that point (perhaps everyone else was!). It's an in-depth course and the summary pages and Q&As are valuable. I realise it would be extremely challenging to administer however, it would be great to have a more challenging exam that encompasses a written paper (open questions). Additionally, I would appreciate a follow-on (optional) exam in about 6 or 8 weeks from now to encourage people to remain engaged with the learnings (via spaced repetition) and practices.

Why_Not_Complete_TEXT: Between starting late because I dropped my youngest at UC Davis in September, taking a two week Europe vacation in October and dealing with the election results combined with my sister sustaining fractured vertebrae in a bus incident in Uganda in November I had distractions. That I was able to finish as much of the course as I did is a testament to how important this information is for me.
Applied_to_life_TEXT: As a practicing Buddhist who belongs to a sanga and sits with them weekly, I have been doing the mindfulness practices for years. I also started a gratitude journal practice over three years ago. Many of these ideas are not new to me. What has been beneficial is learning about the larger efforts toward happiness. Sitting reading about happiness during this election time was a great antidote to the potential fear and anxiety.
Impact_TEXT: One of the fun things about this class was being able to share with others the information I was learning about how to increase happiness. The flow part confirmed that my boredom with work is a more intrinsic issue. Again, I personally found a lot of nourishment from spending this much time each week reading about happiness related topics.

Impact_TEXT:
When I found out about the 'secret' to a happy life, I started to prioritize my friendships/relationships more, and it has made me happier. I stopped isolating myself from my blockmates that I weren't close with. In addition, knowing the science of touch has influenced me to hug friends often and even tell them about the benefits of touch/hugs!
Knowing about empathy has made me more concerned about being able to understand others' pain, and I think it's important so I can be able to help others better.

Weeks_Completed: Week 3: Kindness & Compassion,Week 6: Mindfulness,Week 1: Introduction to the Science of Happiness,Week 2: The Power of Social Connection,Week 4: Cooperation & Reconciliation
Why_Not_Complete: I had less time than I thought I would
Why_Not_Complete_TEXT: I started the course just a couple weeks ago.  I was able to finish the final exam by the deadline by breezing throught the last 3 weeks, just catching the summary of the topics.  I am now going back and finishing up those last 3 weeks.
Applied_to_life_TEXT: I am leading a discussion group (approximately 15 people will attend this particular session), on "The Good Life", about The Grant Study, carried out at Harvard Medical School, probably the longest running longitudinal study (79 years and counting).  I thought that this course was particularly relevant to this discussion.  Also, the positive psychology approach is very interesting to me.
Impact_TEXT: As I indicated previously, I blitzed through the course, so it is really not that possible to evaluate its effect on my life.  Also, it is an exceptionally unusual time for me, because I was very committed to Hillary winning the presidential election, and I am devastated that Trump is President-Elect.  This overriding external fact casts a dark shadow over my life right now.  I am answering this survey the best I can under these circumstances.
Forums_Community_TA_TEXT:
I have one "bee in my bonnet".  Whereas I think that mindfulness has its place, I think the near-universal acclaim for this technique in your course to be very overstated.  Therefore I designate one particular post by either blairmacdonaldbsm or annetflugard (sorry, I couldn't tell which one was the responder) to be the standout.  The original question was posted by AlexG0401 in the Discussion section after Week 6 Mindfulness;  "Could deliberate mind wandering make you happier?"  The response provided the only source from your course which casts any doubt about the universal benefit of mindfulness.

I was a supervisor in a biotech company maybe 20 years ago, and there was a very repetitive task that had to be carried out for an extended time.  If you think that mindfulness, being in the present, was appropriate for carrying out this task, all I can tell you is that I disagree firmly.  My employees were specially allowed to listen to the radio while carrying out this task, and in my view, it would have been dehumanizing to "be in the present" while carrying out this task.  It took 2 hours to complete the task, and really, it could be carried out on auto-pilot, though the task was very important to complete properly.  No, mindfulness is NOT the answer for all situations.  If you want to discuss through email, mine is dmrothstein@gmail.com, in case the surveys do not contain contact information.  I would be happy to elaborate further on this subject if you care to take me up on it.
Forums_NO_TEXT: I was blitzing through the course, taking it within a 2 week period, so I couldn't spend much time on the Discussions, unfortunately.
Value_TEXT:
I thought your take on positive psychology was very important in general, and well worth considering.

I wonder whether you were pushing for reconciliation and forgiveness a little too strongly, in a world where there are plenty of bosses who are mean and massochistic, and where people (especially young women) find themselves in punishing relationships with punitive partners.  When these unfortunate victims of abuse find the courage to leave, they shouldn't even consider reconciliation at that point, in my opinion.  I don't think the presentation was sufficiently balanced in that way, i.e. I think the course promoted positive psychological approaches perhaps to the detriment of the safety of troubled individuals in abusive relationships.

I have already stated my views, above, on overstating mindfulness as a ubiquitous valuable technique, though mindfulness certainly is often an interesting approach.  
Please feel free to email if more elaboration on these points would be of value;  dmrothstein@gmail.com
Course_Like_Most_TEXT: The concepts, utility, and techniques of positive psychology were clearly explained.  Also, the teachers and practitioners of the approach were genuine proponents and very persuasive.  The dedication and effort in communicating the material was obvious;  very nice job!
edx_Changes_TEXT: Good job.  I especially liked the fact that a written transcript was presented side by side, so that I could take good notes on the video material.
Course_Changes_TEXT: As stated previously, I think the communication of the general principles of positive psychology was excellent.  I don't think sufficient care was provided to provide a counterpoint.  I don't believe that mindfulness is appropriate and applicable to all activities, and inadvertently, mindfulness can be dehumanizing in certain specific instances.  I wonder if reconciliation was promoted too strongly for situations of abusive relationships, to the inadvertent detriment of some people in specific situations.  Finally, I took the course in the shadow of political catastrophe, the election of Trump to the presidency.  Certainly some of the techniques of positive psychology are comforting to the individual, but I wonder if some of these techniques may not be appropriate in being firm in fighting against the prejudice and intolerance of the coming administration.  As stated above, if further discussion by email is desirable, you can contact me at dmrothstein@gmail.com

Why_Not_Complete: I had less time than I thought I would
Why_Not_Complete_TEXT: I have learning disabilities and it takes me longer then average to complete any form, usually I get it wrong anyway. I am a slow reader too, but I let the computer read to me, often at the end of the day when I was exhausted and fell asleep, it was good betime stories. I have a memory impairment so I am taking the course for the third time, but this time kind of does not count. I passed it once, but I figured that if a person only takes in 20% on average, then I may as well take it at least 5 times. I will sign up in January for the self paced. I started on week one at week 7 or 8 and made it through week 2 this time. When I took the course the first two times I was in a very challenging place, a break-up, a huge loss of income (not that related to the break- up but partly caused by it) and a bunch of things falling apart. However, I found good in everything and felt blessed (grateful) from the experiences, and found writing three good things to be a life saver, I did it for several month. Many days my three good things would be, I woke up. I am breathing. I have a roof. Many do not get any of those, (I mean without two, you are dead, and it happens often). The second time, I managed to pull of a B grade, and maybe I will be able to make an A.  And I think I can pay for a certificate now. Before that was difficult. Someone was going to pay it for me though, but I never got my ID in, so it didn't happen. That's OK. I want to take it again. It took me basicially two courses to get through one. Now I am doing that again. It can only help me. I reccommend it to friends but no one takes an interest, but I tell them about three good things. I do not even mind my disabilities. I have learned that I can do well academically if I have help.  That was good to know.
Weekly_Hours_TEXT: When I looked at it it was longer, and I can answer the second question because it is not my first time taking it.
Applied_to_life_TEXT: When I get depressed, I consider it a gift because then I know I need to change something. Something as simple as three good things was able to shift my energy. I enjoyed the part of sending love to strangers, but then again that may have been from someplace else. Hahaha! I took a whole bunch of stuff the first time through.
Impact_TEXT: Well, I am a hyper feeler with plenty of empathy and compassion. Self compassion is new though. I started to take therapy for behavior. I have serious defenses that pretty much mess up my human interactions. Especially of family where I have been what is called "identified patient" in psychiatric terms, and that has been hard. So pretty much I do not get along with my family, which is too bad, but knowing this and setting more boundaries helps me to feel better. How did this course help? Self compassion. Considering that I may need to work on getting on with others. People do not feel very safe for me, historically, I have been happy with animals and babies love me. I am very easily hurt. I have been working for years to practice what I call "Duck Wisdom" to let things roll off your back (they have wexing glands to roll water off their feathers). I am even now stepping away from who has been my best and closest friend as self protection as I have seen he is fine with doing things which hurt me. I observed that he is avoidantly attached, me, insecurely attached. Plus we both have overtones of the others main style of attachment. So I saw his kindness, peppered with what is cruelty to me (although may not be to others) is like an addiction, so I am stepping away. I found many others stepping in, to fill the empty space- although I do not feel he does what he does maliciously, I also do not believe he wants to help himself and I can not change another. I guess you mentioned attachment theories in the class. Maybe that was someplace else. I do not want to be like a person pulling a handle at a slot machine for what is good in the friendship, and also getting dumped with the bad. I saw my face age 20 years in one day- I knew I had to put up boundaries. I hope I can keep it up. Human addiction to others is powerful stuff. I do not think you discuss that in the class. Oh well.
Forums_NO_TEXT: First I am not comfortable in showing myself all that much. Second it seemed sort of pointless, like people were out there but they all wanted an audience. Who or how would you make any meaning ful connection, how could you keep track of those long strings, I was never in the right week at the time of everyone else, I didnt really find much to talk about as in, nothing perplexed me, so I had no questions. I'm skipping the next section.
Value_TEXT: They are all good.  You need to add one on food or diet for happiness. Probably not death eaters.  Fruits and vegetables and lower on the food chain is a happiness diet. Sugar, gluten, geeral chemicals, caffeine and other foods can make a person  person imbalanced. Not happy.
Course_Like_Most_TEXT:
Helpful in a hard time. 
Not too hard, but neither too easy.
Learned about myself.
It's taught at UC Berkeley so I feel like a big kid now.

Weeks_Completed: Week 7: Mental Habits of Happiness,Week 8: Gratitude,Week 3: Kindness & Compassion,Week 6: Mindfulness,Week 9: Finding Your Happiness Fit & New Frontiers,Week 1: Introduction to the Science of Happiness,Week 2: The Power of Social Connection,Week 4: Cooperation & Reconciliation
Why_Not_Complete_TEXT: I did all the coursework and did the final exam but didn't get to submit the final exam because I assumed the deadline was PST. I missed the deadline by an hour. I probably shouldn't have left it to the last day and definitely should have accurately read the warning provided. It's weird that despite the fact that I'm not doing the course for credit and I was still able to get feedback on the exam, it still bugged me that I couldn't submit it.
Applied_to_life_TEXT: I talk about studies and prevailing research with my friends that might be relevant to a problem they're describing.
Impact_TEXT:
The course was very informative. The next real challenge is to find an effective way to put the learning into action. It's difficult to take so much information and make it usable

The biggest impact of the course for me was the reminder that being a good, kind person and avoiding being an asshole is really helpful towards your own happiness.
Forums_Community_TA_TEXT: I read through some posts and submitted a couple of my own. I also responded to someone else's post but I never found that part of the course engaging.
Forums_NO_TEXT: I read some other people's posts but didn't usually find posts that I cared about. I also stopped caring about submitting my own posts because I didn't feel like they were being read by others anyway.
Value_TEXT:
The content was excellent. It was useful and interesting. My two thoughts for potential for improvement are:

1) See if there is any good way to make the course slightly shorter. It was  lot to get through. Sometimes but not often the same points were repeated.

2) A little more attention could be given on how to integrate the coursework into your life. That could be an opportunity for research and experimentation in order to figure out the best way to do that.
Course_Like_Most_TEXT: I wanted to get an understanding of where we're at in the field of positive psychology. It gave me an excellent survey of the field.
Course_Changes_TEXT:
1) Don't put a time restriction the submitting the exam. 
2) See if there is anyway to trim the course a little bit.

3) Find someway to make the course more interactive. 

Perhaps have video Skype sessions that students participate in. Maybe have some kind of team project. I'm not sure how to practically achieve this goal but it's worthwhile if you can figure it out.

4) I'd make the midterm and exam more difficult or have the option for greater difficulty. I get that evaluation isn't the purpose of the course and the last thing that you'd like to do is to make a course on happiness stress inducing. However, greater challenge is more motivating to really learn the material for some weirdos like me.

Weeks_Completed: Week 7: Mental Habits of Happiness,Week 8: Gratitude,Week 3: Kindness & Compassion,Week 6: Mindfulness,Week 9: Finding Your Happiness Fit & New Frontiers,Week 1: Introduction to the Science of Happiness,Week 2: The Power of Social Connection,Week 4: Cooperation & Reconciliation
Applied_to_life_TEXT: Most of the suggestions are already a part of my daily schedule, such as mindful breathing, gratitude consciousness, awe etc. Hence, difficult to say that I have tried these as part of the course and also false to say that I haven't!
Forums_NO_TEXT: It needs too much time to follow all discussion. The course material itself requires considerable time and if there is more time, one has to choose between researched additional reading material or discussions...
Value_TEXT: Personally I found all of these topics extremely relevant and the research on them very informative/interesting. They were presented very well too. However, keeping the Eastern philosophical thought in mind, and Indian spiritual literature in particular, these topics barely scratch the surface about our source of happiness and root of emotions and feelings. Perhaps future research will incorporate more of what the vedantic literature has to offer with empirical research to support! We look forward to this as it is really amazing that science finds neurological and biological evidence to support what ancient wisdom has suggested.

Weeks_Completed: Week 7: Mental Habits of Happiness,Week 8: Gratitude,Week 3: Kindness & Compassion,Week 6: Mindfulness,Week 9: Finding Your Happiness Fit & New Frontiers,Week 1: Introduction to the Science of Happiness,Week 2: The Power of Social Connection,Week 4: Cooperation & Reconciliation
Applied_to_life_TEXT: The research on mind wandering and happiness ran very true for me. It allowed me to stay in the present moment because I understood it to be something that would be beneficial to my happiness, (I had to live in the future in my childhood and to heal from my childhood I often lived in the past as an adult). I now can be truly present and this has opened up the door to practice many of the activities taught in the course; active listening, being present, noticing moments of happiness, practicing gratitude
Impact_TEXT: Fortunately, I began a new position and the work environment supports and encourages many of the practices noted in these lessongs; play at work, gratitude and kindness at work.etc. So I have been able to practice and observe these practices. I believe this has reinforced the material covered. In fact I told my boss about the GGSC and he explored the website and at a meeting shared your website and provided staff an overview and link.
Forums_NO_TEXT: it was really about time...the discussions/posts were overwhelming due to the number of posts and I had to read so many and I found them not always helpful or ii had to read a number of posts before I could get to any that rang true for me

Weeks_Completed: Week 7: Mental Habits of Happiness,Week 8: Gratitude,Week 3: Kindness & Compassion,Week 6: Mindfulness,Week 9: Finding Your Happiness Fit & New Frontiers,Week 1: Introduction to the Science of Happiness,Week 2: The Power of Social Connection,Week 4: Cooperation & Reconciliation
Applied_to_life_TEXT: I purposely made more calls to friends and set up more visits. I chose someone to Forgive, and although I still haven't done the multi-step practice, I've felt warmer toward her.  I noticed interpersonal moments that seemed to call for more mindfulness on my part--and usually I stopped, breathed, and managed to "go to that place." For me, renaming "perfectionist" as "maximizer" helped me be more self-compassionate. Instead of an intractable character flaw, I have an unfortunate habit of using a decision-making strategy that does not support happiness -- but neuroplasticity will be my friend in becoming a satisficer.
Impact_TEXT: I haven't yet tried most of the happiness practices, but I've finally found an "accountability buddy" to make sure that I do try them all in the NEXT ten weeks. Or maybe in December! One reason I signed on for the course is that
Forums_NO_TEXT: I fell a week behind, then two...and figured what I might ad wouldn't be read. But I read posts of others, at first.
Team_TEXT: 18 of 35 introduced themselves by where they were from. Then nothing. I did start a discussion "Meet in Person?" And I noted that I saw two geographical clusters (Bay Area and Sacramento) that might meet in person. Only one person responded; I think that after the first week, people didn't go back to the team to see what was happening.
Team_Suggestions_TEXT: Have a small or optional assignment to get the Team to use the Team at least once. OR, have some sort of signal to members when a new discussion has started, or when there have been new posts. Also, maybe y'all could suggest what social media past Teams have used, such as Facebook or Meetup for geographic teams to come together.
Course_Like_Most_TEXT: The readings and videos were smart. In videos, the instructors looked at the camera, and I felt as if I was getting to know them personally. The Practices I tried were meaningful (and I have appointed an "accountability buddy" to check up that I'm trying one new one per week). I appreciate every chart or graph from every video or essay, and I loved every time the steps of an experiment are given. Overall, edX seems to be a good platform for the course. I appreciated the Maximizer/Satisficer concepts, which gave me a way to believe I have a choice, and I'm not necessarily stuck with being a "Perfectionist".
edx_Changes_TEXT: I'd appreciate a signal to show when there are new discussions or posts in my Team. A light on the dashboard would be pretty cool. It'd also be nice if people could make polls for their Team, or if there was a feature that would facilitate people making a time for virtual (or in-person) get-togethers.
Course_Changes_TEXT:
(1) Transcripts need copy editing. It seems like all of them have "word substitutions" that change the meanings of sentences, or turn them into nonsense. Beware the Jabberwock. I would downloaded the transcripts so I could take a highlighter to them, so I was quite aware that they needed help.

(2) Fix mistake in Week 6 Summary, Shapiro's section. There's a sentence: ". According to set point theory,our attitude and behaviors have a bigger effect on our happiness than our external circumstances – and that’s good news for mindfulness."  Neuroplasticity is the good news, yes? She was happy to have set point theory take a hit.

(3) Facilitate people getting together in person...or even virtually. I really wanted to meet others taking the course. I was disappointed that I couldn't find the main Facebook Group for GG101x. When I clicked the syllabus-link and the web-link, I got this message: "Sorry, this content isn't available right now
The link you followed may have expired, or the page may only be visible to an audience you're not in."   Searching on fb for GG101x, I did find 7 closed groups: 4 were based in countries other than US; 1 was LBGTA+ (I'm straight), and 2 were very small (16 members and 10 members). Today I figured out that a "closed" group may still take members, so I made requests to the 2 small local ones. Of course, they could easily be inactive or from a different semester. ///  I also looked on the world map, and found some locals, but didn't have a way to reach out to them. /// Again, I tried to get an in-person thing going with my Team (and would have settled for virtual) but I think most folks in my Team didn't visit the Team forum after the first week.

(4) Provide an "invitation" (or suggest wording) for already-signed-up people to send to friends or colleagues they'd enjoy taking the course with.

Weeks_Completed: Week 2: The Power of Social Connection
Why_Not_Complete_TEXT:
I took the course for the first time two years ago. In the first two weeks I got a really clear and helpful reminder of the key learning; but by week three I felt the course was making me
less happy as it was making me very introspective, and I felt instead I needed to 'get back out there' into life and put the key learnings from the course into action, rather than thinking too much about whether or not I was happy. This worked! So for me there's something there about needing a reminder to put things into practice, particularly as I had 'gone off track' with some core elements (e.g. Gratitude) and had had a difficult time recently. So a question for the team - how to sustain the learning and practices e.g. two years down the line?! And Thank You again for making this wonderful course available.

Weeks_Completed: Week 7: Mental Habits of Happiness,Week 8: Gratitude,Week 3: Kindness & Compassion,Week 6: Mindfulness,Week 9: Finding Your Happiness Fit & New Frontiers,Week 1: Introduction to the Science of Happiness,Week 2: The Power of Social Connection,Week 4: Cooperation & Reconciliation
Applied_to_life_TEXT: I took a lot of notes and have done the "3 Good Things" and felt that this one practice resonated most for me and that it did improve my inner feelings of happiness. Also I now understand how important social connection is, and so try to keep doing small things to maintain interaction with people. I notice how giving little things or being helpful makes me happier. Also, I am making a personal "Happiness Box" which will have flash cards from all the happiness practices presented in the course, so then I can open the box and pick something to do when ever I feel like I need a mood boost - and also I haven't tried all the happiness practices yet (such as the 5 acts of kindness in one day) but can see how they could be fun.
Impact_TEXT: I think that I feel a bit more optimistic when I think about the happiness practices and that each person needs to put a little time into creating happiness.

Course_Like_Most_TEXT: Lots of action steps. The info was easy to understand.
Course_Changes_TEXT: my friend went to a new doctor, and on the first meeting the doctor asked him 5 questions he'd never been asked before by a doctor. They were 1)what do you do for a living? 2) do you like your job? 3) how is your primary relationship 4) how do you sleep & 5) have you undergone any major life changes in the last 6 months. I thought at the time it would be interesting to add some level of info gathering like this to the course. My brother passed away in April, and I buried my father in November. My life experiences  coloured every response I had during the course.  Would it be of benefit to know who's suffering as it must alter the information you gather?

I've also reconnected with friends far and near. I took to heart the recommendation on never stonewalling your significant other.
Course_Like_Most_TEXT: It was a great selection of subjects, interesting information, almost always with great presentation. No pressure, gentler reminders, always cheerful.
edx_Changes_TEXT: The android App makes the course hard to follow, you can't easily read the materials, this makes listening/watching the videos take central stage. I did not try to post on the forums from the app.
Course_Changes_TEXT: Split the Q&A videos into 10 or 15 min chunks.

Impact_TEXT: The truth is that I didn't give a hundred percent to the exercises and I know that I could do better and had I dedicated time to it, I feel that I would really feel a big pleasant change in me.

Why_Not_Complete: I had less time than I thought I would
Why_Not_Complete_TEXT: During the period of doing the course I became the primary caregiver of my 93 year old mother who was enrolled in Hospice. When I told her about the course she replied that she would like to take it too. I told her that she could teach the course in many ways. She was a woman who lived a relatively happy and fulfilled life. We talked about some of the materials and I think that it helped her find more gratitude for her life and appreciation of her family that loved her dearly. She passed in week 8 of the course and I could not get back to it in time to complete it. Still I learned new tools to promote happiness and feel that it helped me though this transition.

Applied_to_life_TEXT: I listened a lot to the guided meditations, I tried the writing exercices. But I never managed the 5 good things exercice. I never found the place and occasions in my daily life to try it...
Impact_TEXT: Though the scores of the previous page were rather low, in fact during the course, when i was immerged in the course and the exercice, I felt truly better, more relaxed, more optimistic, more kind and patient than I used to be. Applied_to_life_TEXT: I've become more aware of the effect my reaction to situations has on others around me, as well as my mood.  I try to choose a more positive response.  I've also noticed how I speak to my spouse and have begun to recognize how important it is to be positive in our communication, which I've been attempting.  I have started a gratitude journal, and am trying to be consistent with my entries.
Forums_NO_TEXT: It took quite a bit of time to complete the course content and I didn't want to take time away from getting the course finished.  I am not very social either, and prefer to keep to myself.
